Mouthfeel starts off sweet (almost too intensely sweet), but it quickly dissipates into puckery sourness.
Thanksgiving bottle, thanks to kcorum in trade, rusty pick color, lots of jammy cherry and cranberry flavors, gets more sour as it warms, nice carbonation to round it out
Bottle at TSODRBSG 13. Red amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma is cherries , almond, malt. Flavour is cherries, almond, malt, apple, oak. Very nice beer.

Bottle courtesy of Dmbforever. Poured into an 8oz snifter. Red amber brown in color with cream colored head. Decent head retention (about a minute and a half). Decent lacing and the head shows back up with each swirl. Aroma of dark sweet fruit (raspberry, cherry, tart apple). Aroma also has some slight funk to it, like earthy yeastiness. Taste is of cherries, raspberry, some plum, and blackberry as well. Very sweet. The tart cranberries are nice, but they dont cut the sweetness as much as Id like. Good carbonation and medium body wrap the tongue in the fruit sweetness. Definitely another enjoyable brew from New Glarus.

Beautiful fruit beer. Mahogany and red color with light pink head. The aroma is like nice sparkling fruit juice....apples, cherries, cranberries all accounted for. The taste follows, just sweet enough. Slight sourness. Masterful.

750 ml. Amber body with orange highlights. Fizzy, off-white head. Big aroma of cherries, raspberries, overripe prunes. Hint of basement. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter and lightly acidic. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet, lightly bitter and lightly to moderately acidic. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Tart finish. Lots of fruit flavors with a hint of toasted grain, funk and overripe fruit. A bit medicinal.

Bottled the time it was bottled.

Pours a browned pink with a fleeting dusty rose cap. Smells of apples, cherries, oak and some lactic acid. Taste is cranberry well balanced with apples and cherries. The beer leans toward the tart side of things and helps the flavor profiles balance out like a well blended wine. There is a medium on lightly cloying body with moderate carb and a semi dry finish that makes me want the beer ice cold and in gulping portions on a early summer morning. Really a refreshing beer I believe to be an absolutely fantastic deviation from the normal New Glarus beers.

Pour is ruby red with a bubbly off-white head. Aroma is of sour cherries, and apple juice. Head faded rather quickly after picking out the aroma. Flavor is green apples at the front but transitions into a sour cherry finish. Dry and tart, good.

750ml bottle: This one pours a ruby hued amber color. There was a fizzy off-white head that didnt linger long or leave much lacing. The nose is good. It almost smells like fruit juice, but not as sweet. Cherry, apple and cranberries are the most notable. The taste is also very good. There is a tartness and sweetness at the same time. Cherries, cranberry and apple. Somewhat lighter body. This is interesting and wonderful. It is only 5.1%, but you dont even realize there is alcohol in this.

Bottle 750ml. @ [ The Danish Summer Gathering, TSODRBSG13 ].Clear medium amber orange colour with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy apple, cherry, craneberry. Flavour is heavy sweet with a long duration, apple, cherries, cranberry, but also artificial ! Body is medium to full, texture is oily and sticky, carbonation is soft. [20130831]

Bottle @ GABF 2013. Pours a hazy reddish amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity sour tart berry aroma. Fruity weak sweetish sou tart cherry flavor. Has a fruity sour tart cherry finish.

A: Dark Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, No Head, No Lacing

Overall, Nice fruit flavor but weak of the carbonation, decent.

Extremely sour fruity aroma, first apple then lambic fruity sourness. Excellent carbonation even in the small stupid gabf glass. Perfect blende of the fruits and the sourness, I felt like I was in the cranberry bogs. I would have stayed at the booth all night but the line would have rioted.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2015 Thanks Jeff. An absolute huge raspberry aroma to go with the bright red color. Candy fruit all over the place. Huge thick head. A big candy raspberry flavor. Tart in the end. Very sweet. A solid fruit beer.
Not as good as I was expecting. A bit too sweet and medicinal tasting. Still a good beer, but there are better and easier to get options.

Bottle thanks to bytemesis. Little foam after the pour, warm brown color brightly tinted red. Aroma is strongly reminiscent of the Wisconsin red but with obvious tones from the apples. The apples and cranberries bring a welcome tartness that keeps this beer from wearing out its welcome after one glass. Equal parts sweet and dry, tingly on the tongue. A very light toasty flavor detected in the finish. Overall, it perhaps doesnt hit the peaks of Wisconsin red but it achieves a much better balance.

This pours an attractive reddish amber color with a lasting off white ring of bubbles for a head. Big fresh fruit nose with lots of apple and cherry notes. Sweet tart candy taste with berries, apple juice, and some orange flavors. Gently fizzy on the tongue. This is a great, juicy, fruity beer.

Sampled at GABF 2013. Pours reddish-orange from the bottle with a frothy off-white head. Tart cranberry nose with cherry making its way through. Phenomenal taste; tart cranberry and cherry smack the tongue with a wonderful, juicy flavor. The finish is great, yet here is where it falters slightly when compared to Belgian Red (this is more of a limitation of the apple and cranberry that are not as juicy as cherries). Not surprisingly, this is a great fruit beer.

Delicious apple-cranberry nose that follows into the mouth. A medium sweetness that doesnt overpower, and nicely complemented by the bitter and dry cranberry-juice-like finish. 

Delicious beer that tastes like fresh apple-cran juice.
Sampled at GABF 2013. An incredible aroma and flavor. Very fresh and tart fruitiness. Medium sourness. Smooth and sweet.
Pours a reddish color with pink head. Aromas that remind me of smelling a fruit tray. This beer has some amazing flavors from the fruit combinations added. This is one the best beers Ive had.

The beer appears ruby to amber with a frothy, off white head. The aroma brings a potent dose of apples, pears, tart cranberries, sweet fruit juices. A typical New Glarus fruit beer. Bold and assertive. Teeming with flavor. Sweet cherries and apples with minimal alcohol. Though a bit sweet for my tastes, there's no denying that this is a terrific beer. Fantastic in small quantities.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Excellent fruit beer. Complex aroma of mixed fruits and a touch of the oak. Flavor is aggressively sweet and sharp. But it never becomes cloying and is held in just enough by the wood. Still, this is a fruity juicy beer. Yet somehow it all works. Abv is undetectable, the right enough of carbonation to keep it from being juice, and a complex layering of fruits. This is what a fruit beer should be. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very well done! Syrupy sweet, but somehow manages not to be a fruit bomb. I pick up primarily cherries and cranberries; can't say I discern apple. Slightly woody, which I think is what ensures this isn't a sugar bomb. A hint of sourness. Overall, a pretty complex dessert beer -- a difficult task for a syrupy sweet beer. A-

Another great fruit beer New Glarus. Pours lightly hazed reddish amber with lively off-white head. Aromas of cherries, cranberries, apples, sweetness, and light tartness. Flavors of sweet malts, sweet fruits including cranberries and apples with some tartness in the finish. Body was lighter than Belgain Red which is a good thing.

Bottle pour ruby amber color. Nose immediate sweet tart fruit. Lots of apple, some cherry, Taste tart up front, gets those salivary glands going. Followed by sweet apple, some cherry. Not as coyingly sweet as belgian red. Cranberries seem to come through in the end. Many layers of flavor.

Deep berry red body, large off-white head, sparse lacing. Cherries, cranberries, apples,and some other dark berries. Medium to light bodied, moderate carbonation, lively acidity, nice tartness, refreshing finish.

08-10-2013
Aroma us set cherries and apples, appearance is dark red, taste is sweet fruit, great beer, love it
Holy cow. This is fantastic. Lots of berries. Raspberries. Apples. Cranberries. Slightly tart. Very nice beer. Lots of wonderful fruit. Very nice. Thanks to Ben at BOSS for this.

Via trade with losthops287. The aroma is apples, cherries, maybe some cranberry, but all fruit, with slight sourness. The appearance is translucent deep amber, off white head The flavor is apple, Cheries, tart and sour. The finish is fruity sweet, light sour acidicity, tart cherry. Medium in body. Nice fruit ale.

I dont know how these guys do it....so consistently knock it out of the park with their fruit ales. Cherry is still a stand out, but the apple and cranberry marry together with it so well that it is a delicious fruit cocktail explosion. Im hunting for anything I didnt like about but nothing comes to mind. Perfect balance.

25.4 oz bottle; purchased at least several months ago (maybe as far back as February 2013); consumed on 9-15-13. Sweet, tart, musty, sour, very strong aroma features candy sugar, apple, salt, lemon, and berry scents. Pours an effervescent, clear copper with a reddish hue and pinkish taupe head. Sweet taste reminiscent of a berry tart baked good. Tonic water, lemon, dirt, and clay flavors. Harsh but welcome heat produced in back of throat. Medium body. Lively, frothy, and smooth in the palate. Very enjoyable beer but the novelty wears off a bit upon multiple sips.

750ml bottle from beernbourbon, thanks a bunch. Clear rusty amber with a foamy beige head. Aroma is all fruit; apples, cherries and cranberries. Flavor is lightly tart and acidic apple and cranberry with some sweet pie cherry and light malt backbone. Light body with lively carbonation. Another fantastic New Glarus fruit beer, I dont know how they get so much flavor and aroma without it being overly sweet.
Bottle @ Danish Summer Gathering, 2013. Reddish body with a small wwhite head. Aroma is perfume, berries, black currant winegums. Flavour is berries and black currant winegums. Nice beer.
I cant imagine a beer I would rather drink on a regular basis moreso than this. The flavors are so huge and inviting that there is never too much. to polish off
Bottle @ Danish Summer Gathering, 2013. Trade with AdamJackson. Pours ruby amber with a small creamy head. Raspberries, funk, almond and strawberries. Smooth and dry. Acidic fruity finish. Nice.

After staring me in the eye for quite some time down in the cellar, finally a time to crack one open (for all of the praise I give to NG for their wonderful brews, I REALLY want them to put the fruit beers in 12 oz bottles...seriously, I dont need .75L of this stuff at a time!) Anyways, I digress...pours a ruddy brownish red - minimal head. Aroma is strong and inviting...candied fruit, hint of sourness...yum! I would say the flavor is cranberry forward, but the apples and cherries round things out nicely...just a great meld of tartness abounds...generally tart/sour, hint of sweet malt in the background to keep things balanced, and no hint of cloying (not that I expected any...) Palate is actually quite easy drinking for the type of beer, and although it was great to share at a party, I could probably kill half a bottle on my own quite easily (not so with the B Red). I expected a homer, and a round tripper is what I got...

Absolutely Brilliant !!! .. deep ruby .. solid foam .. . berry, fruit juice, raspberry, dark winter berries + what not .. . nice solid beer all around, i like wisconsin red/ rasp tart a bit better but as i said, brilliant stuff!! .. . .. yesterday i made the best bbq sauce in history, today- i sat on the couch all day and scratched my butt.. .. a solid weekend..

Poured from the bottle. Color is an orange amber with good clarity. a nice thin white head, carbonation is fine.aroma is cherry and cranberry. Sourness is very minor, more of just a slight tartness. Flavor is sour apple and chaeeries, with the cranberry tartness coming in on end, does taste like a fruit cider. this is very good and very drinkable. Highly recommended.

750ml bottle. Pours a hazy deep red color with a huge frothy off white head. Sweet aromas of cherry, apples, cranberries, and grapes. Taste is of tart cranberry juice, a mix of sour and sweet apples, and cherries. Great beer.

Bottle thanks to Randall. Clear reddish copper pour with a white head. Big cherry aromas. Wow, effervescent with tingly cherry, sour apple, and bitter cranberry highlights. Tasty but almost overbearingly so. Intense fruit with caramel malt lowlights. Definitely unique..

A steady pour into my New Belgium globe glass produces a three-finger thick, pink tinged, tan colored head. The beer is a dark, concentrated plum-amber color that shows a brilliantly clear, cranberry-juice red hue when held up to the light. The aroma is fruity and sweet; candied cranberries, fruity sweet cherries, and flora apple notes also have a touch of fruit tartness to it. The aroma reminds me quite a bit of a some sort of cough syrup, or perhaps of some sort of syrup I should be using in a desert. I cant even pretend to smell anything of the base beer here.

Sweet with lots of prickly carbonation and predominantly fruity. The finish tastes characteristically of apples, while up front the cherry notes intermingle with a light cranberry character; the cherries also linger into the finish with a cherry skin fruitiness that lingers a bit on the palate. There is a touch of tartness here that helps to slightly temper the sweetness. At times the mix of fruit reminds me of childrens aspirin in the finish. The body is certainly a bit thick, it has a fullness to it that lingers a bit on the palate; definitely something to be sipped slowly. Once again the base beer is pretty much non-existent, perhaps a hint of maltiness, but I could very well be imagining it.

Nice as a desert, and in fairly small quantities, or if you have a serious sweet tooth. I honestly dont understand why this is ranked so highly compared to the fake, sweet, fruit Lambics out there; clean, candy sweet, and fruity, they are quite similar and can work in certain situations, though for my particular palate I wouldnt choose to drink these very often.
Bottle @ TSODRBSG13, Ulfborg. Hazy dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy cherries and marzipan. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish. 310813

Bottle. Dark amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, cherries, rashberries, fruit and marzipan. Flavour is malt, cherries, fruit, marzipan, almond, sweet, fruit, rashberries and a little acid .
Bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich cherries, red fruits, malt and hops. Nice!

75 cL bottle. Pours cloudy amber with a small off white head. Aroma is raspberry. Sweet, sulphorish and citric raspberry. Tart, raspberry and dry fruity. Sweet and citric finish. Mouthwatering. Smooth fruity finish.

Amazing fruit beer that manages to blend cranberries, apples, and cherries into one amazing flavor. its simply wonderful. its also a great conversation starter at bars that serve it from the bottle. grab a couple glasses and share. Its a beer that even folks who dont claim to like beer can enjoy.

A - pours a hazy muddy maroon like apple cherry cider with low off white head. S - holy sweet fruit juice batman. Overripe apples/cranberries/raspberry juice/white grape juice. Musty notes, honey and floral notes swirl around the appeals albeit a tad overly sweet aromas. M - lively carb and a bright though sticky feel. Nice full palate, heavy on the sweet. Lingering fruitiness. T - fruit forward for sure. Apple/white grape/peach/cran/berry juice. Bam. Must, honey, brown sugar and light vegetal notes. O - how does new glaurus make such good fruit beers. Good stuff. 3.9

Dark cherry color,up to the light its a bright clear darkish red almost burgandy or something. Light foamy with some lace.
 Aroma is pleasant with cherry and other dark sweet tart fruits.Vanilla.Fruit candy.
Taste is sweet,with tart but more of a nice sweetness. Appely and carmelly. Sweet tart cherries on the finish. Appley tartness.Nice fruit beer havent had many but this is really good. Tart but balanced  with a bit more sweetness,and not sour at all.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2015 Pour is dark hazy pinkish... With a frothy and light pink head.
Aroma is delicious and subtle of green apples, wild berries and some "other fruits"
The taste is really fruity-sweet, with a little bit of tartness to it.. 
Average bodied, with a semi-flat carbonation. I really do like the subtleness of this.. 

Pretty darn tasty ans enjoyable.

Bottle pours brownish red with nice one finger yellowish head and good lacing. Aroma of apple, cranberry, cherry and slight funk. Initial taste sweet but as you progress through the glass the sourness and tartness take over like drinking a sourball. Prolonged tartness on the finish. Palate mildly thick. No discernible alcohol. Too sour and tart for my taste.
Strong and nice aroma of berries, and other fruits, mixed with sour fruits. Beautiful raspberry red/amber color. Tart sweet fruit in the front. Dry and sweet finish.
750 bottle pours dark cherry looking. Huge fruit nose-wow. Taste is full of fruit trees-goes down so smooth and easy. Drink if you can find.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
Pours a clear dark ruby - smells like Thanksgiving - an explosion of sweet apple and cherry pie fillings with a side of tart cranberry sauce - a light kiss of oak and very mild fruit skin funkiness - full but fairly soft carbonation - sweet kriek (cherry, oak, spices) character leads to a balancing tart cranberry
middle, followed by apple pie filling - kriek-like qualities return for the finish - cherry skin, light oak, a little bit of funk - prickly acidity on the tail end - even though their tartness adds a balance to the sweetness, the flavor of the cranberries seems to be the odd man out here - but this is a minor complaintabout an otherwise awesome beer.

This beer pours a deep reddish-brown color with a medium tan head that diminishes gradually to a film. Rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of dark fruits and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of cherries, tart apples and earthy yeast. The finish is lightly sour with a green apple aftertaste. Good beer all around.
Bottle from the bro known as Homer321. Pours a nice almost wine red. Slight white head. Juicy taste. Cherry, raspberry, grapes, apple. Very crisp and refreshing.

Draft at brewery. The pour is a muted reddish, sparkling. The aroma is all fruit. So is the taste. Much less sour than I was expecting. Get a great blend of all the fruits. A very good beer for a hot summer day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Reddish brown body with a grey head. Fruit sweet tart nose. Nice tart flavor. Just a bit of jawi tightening in the finish. Cranberry is dominant but not overwhelming. Very nice beer. Even better when i can drink this and poke brad in the ass.

Bottle shared by Kevin. Pours hazy amber to brown with a medium, creamy beige head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is apple, cranberry and raspberry with cookie malt. Flavor is lightly tart fruits, sweet malt and a dry finish. Medium body and light carbonation.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours pink/red with low off-white head. Lots of lacing. Aroma is of fruits, cherries. Taste is of fruits, cherries, sligth sourness. Acetic. Sweet. Palate: Medium body. Overall: Lots of cherries in there. Enjoyable.
#2000. Bottle. Brown pour with tan head. Apple, some tart cherries and sweetness in aroma. Cherry flavored very with some light apple and cranberry tones. Very nice.

Bottle. Clear red pour with white head. Aroma of jujubes, gummy bears to be precise, quite striking aroma, fruity in a very sweet (jelly) like way. Flavor brings a more "realistic" fruit. Distinguishable flavors of apple and cranberry. Very slight tartness but mostly sweet. Not overly syrupy like raspberry tart and WBR. Palate is very light and easy drinking. Actually enjoyed this NG fruit beer.

Bottle shared by Tommy, thanks a lot! Pour is hazy bright red with white head and good lacing. Aroma is sirupy, sweet cranberries, cherries, light aplle notes. Taste is sweet berries (gummies-like), apples, light tartness. medium body, sticky, average carbonation. Definitly not a fan of new glarus fruit beers.

Bottle (750 ml). Thanks to MatSciGuy for this one! Clear ruby/amber with a small persistent white head and intense lacing. Aroma of cherry gummies, cranberries, sweetness and green apple. Taste is moderately sweet and heavily fruity with tons of fruity gummies (cherry, cranberries and green apple) and light acidic presence from the cranberries. Sirupy mouthfeel. Light to medium body. Moderate carbonation. Like Raspberry Tart and Wisconsin Belgian Red, this is a low abv sipper. Sweet and fruity, really gummies-like. Still enjoyable.

Bomber. What a great save. Very similar in body to Big Red. Nose and taste have a lot of similarities with plenty of fruit. Taste has that nice cranberry tart bite that cuts the sweetness. Very nice on this hot summer day. New Glarus just keeps churning out goodness.

Pours a deep red brown color with a modest, very creamy, light tan head. Aroma has a lot of tart cranberry and cherry sweetness with a sweet apple juice finish. You can taste the cherry in this brew but I think its the cranberry that really makes this beer. The cranberry tartness complexed with the imparted yeast acidity and tartness makes this beer very good. The finish to the beer has a strong apple juice quality in both flavor and texture. Body is light with some stickiness too it. The carbonation is very fine and lends a slight sharpness too it. Overall a very good beer. The sweetness is a bit on the strong side for one person to consume and I could see this being a fantastic beer in smaller doses as a dessert. The apple juice quality at the end of the flavor would my only knock as it doesnt seem to be transformed in the brewing process. Still a great beer.

750 ml bottle thanks to JStax. Pours ruby red with a small fizzy, bubbly head that fades to ring. Rich, juicy sour cherry and green apple aroma. Taste is moderately sweet with a crisp tart finish. Great blend of cherries and apples, dont detect any cranberries. Love the soft tingling carbonation. Drinks like a liquid jolly rancher. Love the New Glarus fruit beers. Need to try more of them.

Clear amber pour, thin off white head and light lacing ... aroma of cherries, cranberries and apple ... smells a lot like belgian cherry .. taste is of cherries, cranberries mostly tart and sour, apple is light in both the aroma and taste ... kind of like blending raspberry tart and the belgian cherry with a slight smack of apple ... has a light bitter sour tart mouthfeel ... excellent brew

750 ml bottle. Pours a cranberry ruby red color with a small cream colored head. Aroma of sour cherries, cranberry and apple. Taste of sour cherries, cranberries, apples and light hints of oak. Tart and sour yet sweet. Superb.

Draft at Bodegas Brewpub. Pours viscous cranberry with very little head. No lacing in the glass. Big fruit on the nose. Very sweet on the tongue but not in an artificial way. The cherry and cranberry is more forward on the tongue with the apple coming through on the finish. Theres also some tartness to keep things interesting. This does linger for a while. Just a fantastic example of the style.

750 ml bottle courtesy madbeerbaron. This one pours a mostly ruby red with a pinkish hue and topped by a thin head of beige colored foam that quickly recedes while leaving some lacing around the glass. The aroma is really nice showing notes of sour cherries, cranberries, apples, and melange of other dark fruits. The flavor follows suit with the tart cherries and sour apples up front followed by cranberries and some sweet dark fruits. Nearly full bodied and round with tingling carbonation that leads a sweet-tart finish. This is definitely not a sour, but the tart fruit and sweet flavors play off each other perfectly. Another home run for the best fruit beer brewer in the business. Bravo Dan! Awesome stuff.

750-ml bottle. Pours a clear ruby with no head. Very sweet, fruity nose of apple, cranberries, and cherries, which becomes the dominant tone after a while. The taste mirrors the aroma: Sweet apple quickly followed by tart raspberries and cherry to finish, with not even a hint of bitterness. Extremely clean mouthfeel, abrupt tart finish, not much carbonation. Drinks as close to fruit juice as a beer can. Incredibly well-crafted, but doesnt quite match the hype.

Well... A delicious easy drinking beverage. Similar to juicy juice or those non alc bubbly beverages. This is better and really good just not really my thing maybe...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at Bigelos Sour Sunday and it was a highlight for me despite not being a sour. A reddish pour and it is hazy. Aromas of cherries and apples. Some wine notes with oak. The flavors of all the fruit combines very nicely with the wine barrel oak and yeast. Cranberries? I didnt taste them. This was a winner.

Bomber bottle share. Aroma is sour cherries. Appearance is a murky dark bronze with a good cream head. Taste is sour that turn very cherry. A great fruit beer. Palate is sour. Overall, great beer. Would buy again fo sho. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very disappointing beer. The nose and appearance are what is good and reminds of the Red but the taste is off and is that cliched "cough syrup" feel and taste. The taste is mainly of cherries, but unlike the Red there is no tartness just artificial sweetness. The apple and cranberry are there but muddled and masked by the oak. The lack of tartness is surprising with the inclusion of cranberries. I could not finish my glass nor did I want to try.
Red orange. Tastes like belgian red. Lots of sour cherry. Grannysmith apple, didnt notice the cranberry until i read the bottle. Very good stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2013   Casey very kindly brought this along, thanks Casey. Sat drinking this sat at home with Casey, Traci & Loz 08.07.13   Pours reddy colour, like a deep sunset looks lovely. Stewed apple and rich cherry nose, I get cinnamon but I think that is just an association thing with the stewed apple. I sniff again and get wonderful rich sweet fruity nose with cherries in abundance. This is a lovely juicy fruity beer, it is intensely flavour packed with oodles of cherries backed up with apple. Interestingly, much like another recent beer Ive had the cranberries are there and whilst I cannot necessarily pick them out they do make a difference, and I think that they more than anything else in this beer leave that dryness around the gums and add a really nice dimension to this beer, starts sweet then goes dry. Love it.  A8 A4 T9 P4 Ov17 4.2

Serendipity is certainly interesting. It reminds me of the non-alcoholic sparklers that sometimes appear on new years eve but much better. The carbonation and acidity are pretty intense together and I would probably prefer the carbonation dialed back a bit. Nevertheless, it is an appealing experience if intense and might be the kind of thing Id get a yen for if I drank it regularly.

[1pt 9fl oz bottle, courtesy of Benjii and Sevare] Clear cherry red pour, thin, slightly pinkish lacing. Aroma of sweet cherry, all the way. Tastes like a Jolly Rancher. Supremely drinkable [21062013]
From a bomber. Mild acidic aroma. Nice clear sorta ruby appearance. Mild moderately acidic flavour outstanding balance. Sweet but not too sweet. Good.

Waxed bottle and served in my NG flute and a random tulip: Pours a beautiful crimson hue topped by a white frothy head and spotty lace. The aroma has a lot of cherry pits, crab apple skin and cranberry juice along with pils malt and a shocking cardamom and dill spice like vapour. The taste is 100% what you expect from the nose, extreme fruit, tartness, light farmhouse earthiness, clean pils malts. LOVELY! The mouth feel is uber refreshing but a tad sticky upon the edges and finish. This is a wonderful brew but I still can not wait to get my hands on a fresh Belgian Red.

(750ml bottle) Pours a ruby body with a tall beige head. Aroma of apple, cherries, and cranberries. Flavor of cherries, caramel, apple, honey, and cranberries. Enjoyable nose upon pouring, but became more noticeably unbalanced as the beer opened up.

Bomber from Mars Cheese Castle. Soooo glad I picked this up. Phenomenal beer. Waxed cap bottle, ruby red and orange pour, effervescent and lively. Just terrific lacing. Cranberries and cherries on the nose. The taste is cranberry but not overwhelming or too sweet. Finishes dry with apple skins and red cherry juice. Clean finish. This would be at home at the Thanksgiving dinner table just as much as an aperetif on its own on a warm summer evening. Very special beer, hope to find it again.

Hazy dark pink/purple pour with an off white head. Aroma is cider, cherries, fruit fruit and fruit. A bit of a tart twang as well. Flavor is similar. A really nice fruit beer that showcases the fruit without being glorified kool-aid.
Bottle shared by Steve, thanks! Pours a dark red with medium white head. Big nose of cherry/berry sweetness. Flavor is cherry, cranberry tartness. Light bodied and slightly medicinial. Fun.

Bottle thanks to pokgye. Somewhat hazy reddish-brown color with a small off-white head. Complex fruit aroma with cherry dominating but a hint of red apple. The flavor is sweet (as in sugary) but also sweet (as in awesome) with sweet cherry, cranberry, and apple. A bit like an awesome, more complex cider. Medium-bodied and smooth with average carbonation. Phenomenal beer.

750 mL. Split

A: Prune colored with a ring of off white head.

N: Lots of cherry, raspberry, and apple. Very sugary sweet. Some grape juice. Smells like a cocktail, but its more complex than Raspberry Tart.

T: Sweet, but not overpoweringly so. Theres a touch of sourness about it.

M: Syrupy, sticky, but still light.

O: Think this is my favorite of their fruit beers. More complex and less sweet than raspberry tart.

Bottle.thanks Benji and Sev. Red with off white head. Aroma is full on cherry with some apple. Taste has rich cherry, like cherry drop sweets with some apple. Sweet and slightly sticky. Delicious but not really a beer

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2015 bottle at home .. Huge thanks to Sev ... pink red ... thin off white head ... soft sweet cherry nose .. deep and rick and complex nose ... soft sweet frutis ... mellow cherry ... light peach ... light tart rasp ... long soft cherrry ... soft creamy lovely  bottle at home .. copper .. thin tan lacing ... softy sweet ffruits ... soft fruits ... juicy fruts ... soft floral fruits .. soft fruit .. soft sweet cherry fruit nose ... little cold .. sweet fruits ... oily fruits .. soft fruits... oily fruit... soft fruit ... ligth sweet fruit 3.9

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2013 Bottle from a friend. Pours a deep ruby red with off white two finger head. Huge  bouquet of cranberry and cherry, sweet and tart smelling. Flavor is more cherry heavy with hints of the cranberry coming through. Very sweet, slight tart. More medicinal than I had hoped but not overwhelming. Lingering tart cranberry that grows on me while I go. Light to medium mouthfeel with lots of carbonation. Cool beer, but not as good as Raspberry Tart.

Sample, green bottle, 1 pint 9 ounces, from and with Luc Bourbonnière, savoured on March 8 2013; eye: caramel with a reddish hue, clear, no effervescence, really tiny ring of beige head; nose: cherry, caramel, light malt, sugar; mouth: cherry, caramel, light malt, sugar, light acidity, slight green apple, sugar, sweet finale with presence of caramel, medium body, average carbonation, quite sweet, slick texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, bouteille verte, 1 pinte 9 onces, de et avec Luc Bourbonnière, savourée le 8 mars 2013; il : caramel avec une teinte rougeâtre, limpide, pas deffervescence, très petit anneau de mousse beige; nez : cerise, caramel, léger malt, sucre; bouche : cerise, caramel, léger malt, sucre, légère acidité, très léger pomme verte, sucre, finale sucrée en cerise avec présence de caramel, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, pas mal sucrée, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

750 ml bottle received by my secret santa. Thank you joeneugs! Pours hazy ruby red with a small bubbly pinkish beige head that slowly dissipates while leaving a small trace on the glass. Smell is very fruity with crushed cherries, juicy green apples, cranberry juice, dark bread, moist wood, red wine, hay, mixed fruit hard candy, mashed frozen red berries, lemon zest and hints of cereal. Taste is sweet and very fruity with dark cherries, sour cherries, cranberry juice, lemon juice, apple juice, bread, wood, pomegranate, raspberries, hay, lemon zest and hints of unripe strawberries. Mouthfeel is fruity tart, tiny sticky sweet, slightly astringent and light to medium bodied. Finish is fruity with bread, sour cherries, cranberries, green apples, biscuits, wood, hay and lemon zest. Quite nice an not as sweet as other New Glarus fruit beer offerings Ive tried.
Bottle (75), courtesy of _angst. CLear chestnut, medium beige head. Fruity aroma with cherries and apples. Slightly sweet, low to medium acidiy.
Holy cow awesome fruit beer, sour, raspberries galorr, bomber thanks to Tastybeer. Yum!

750mL Bottle, purchased at Keyport Liquors - Superior, WI> Cough syrup cherry aroma, cooked and candied. Flavors roam around sweet tart territory, with more medicinal cherry flavors, and some strange bitter astringency from the cranberries. Sweet, sweet, sweet. This is rough, lightly alcoholic candy. Its so sweet that the rim of my glass is getting sticky after a dozen sips.

Bottle at "En liten provning hos larsniclas" hosted by Alex ( _angst_). Clear amber/reddish beer with a small head. Fruity raspberry aroma, cranberries, acidic, sweetish, cherry seeds, caramel. Sourish cherry flavor, cranberries, cherry seeds, sweetish, strawberries, acidic, peach. Sweetish finish, cherry seeds, cranberries, raspberries,, some sugar.
