Reddish amber with a white head. 
Very fruity in both aroma and flavour; mostly cranberries and cherries.  Also some cinnamon/apples.
Sourish notes; some balsamic vinegar. Overall a bit too sweet.

1 of 2 bottles purchased at random WI gas station during Dells spring break trip. Holy crap was this good. Great fruit flavor with just enough tart sourness to make it great. The sourness and barrel treatment did not overpower the fruit. Awesome.

Pours red orange. Aroma of apple and cherry. A light white foam. Sweet apple taste with a cranberry tart flavor. Slippery mouth feel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle shared with artmcd. Poured red orange clear no foam. Aroma of sweet funky apples. Slightly sour smooth apple taste. Nice

750ml waxed bottle into a HF wine glass. Thanks Yamar68!

A - Pours a clear dark red body with a fingers worth of purple stained foam. Leaves behind a patchy cap and some solid lacing with a swirl. Looks very juice like but with an excellent head.

S - Tart cranberries, ripe apples, some cinnamon spice from the cherries, and thats it. Ripe, fresh, and juicy are all terms that come to mind. This might blur the line between beer and fruit juice, but who cares when it smells this great.

T - Pleasantly tart cranberries, ripe apples, and some cherries and spice on the finish. Just a touch of malts can be found here but otherwise this is like drinking a sparkling cran-apple juice. Mouth feel is medium bodies with low carbonation. Im not sure if its detrimental or not but it does feel somewhat syrupy. That does make it a bit of a chore to drink solo but the flavor is so amazing that slowly sipping on it is somewhat welcomed.

O - New Glarus simply kills it with their fruit "beers". This happy accident ale certainly is a happy accident. Belgian Red really impressed me and making up for the lack of cherries with cranberries and apples is just genius. Just the right amounts of sweetness and tartness .

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 Bottle thanks to a trade..Pour is redish with a pink head..Nose is fruit juice, apple, pear, cranberry, cherries, sweet..Taste is much of the same with a nice refreshing taste..I could have drank this whole bottle by myself..

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2014 75cl, no mention of ABV, new exclusive American brew Anno 2012, with cherries, cranberries and apples, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex fruit brew, fruity/sour and slightly vinous/sweet, heavy, yet balanced, clear, small head, very good brew, yet expensive!
Bottle from Ben, thanks! Pours dark reddish brown with low head.  Smell is sweet dark fruits, taste is crisp apples and sweet berry with nice acidity on the finish.  a bit too sweet for me.
Bomber. Cranberry color with no head. Dark sweet fruit aromas. Dark fruits and apples. Amazing.
So good. Nose was bouquet of red fruit. Taste was amazing. Sweet and fruity with a hint of cranberry sourness at the end. Could not drink everyday but wonderful change of pace beer

Thank you Adam. Enjoyed at cellar temp with friends

A -  Blood red, HUGE creamy head that fades to a still nothing

S - The amount of apple pulp in this beer is amazing. its mind-blowing how apple-y this is. You get some raspberry tartness as well

T -  Wow. Reminds me of Juicy Juice. Apple and cranberries are fantastically blended. Its sweet, tart, lovely

M - thin body, slick and sweet finish like a fruit juice

O - Its hard to review this beer...its just all fruit juice with carbonation and so sweet and delicious. very impressive but Im happy to be splitting this with a few friends.
Aromatics are awesome! Probably just the apples speaking, but this is so much more complex than the Raspberry Tart or Belgian Red! Love it!

Westmeisters Birthday Beer Tasting Extravaganza Beer #6.  I went from never having tried a New Glarus brew to trying two in a day, and I didnt even have to schlep it up to Wisconsin.  Thanks to Westmeister for busting this one out the cellar.  Pours a brownish red and smells live cider of the non-alcoholic variety.  The sweet and tart flavors are well blended.  The carbonation was ideal, as any more would have made it seem like a soda.  Great beer.  Want more.  Bottle - Westmeisters House - Cumming, GA

Bottle poured a deep red color with a fizzle of white head. Aroma has great fresh fruit, juicy apple, cranberry, cherry, and light tartness. Mouth feel is light and the carbonation medium with great crispness. Flavor has juicy apples, tart cranberry, light cherry, some pak, and a great tart and sweet contrast. Really an incredible fruit beer.

A bottle shared with Jenny to celebrate our first Victoria Day. Pours a cranberry red, pinkish and gold hues, with medium khaki head. Aroma is rich of cherry pie. A bit sugary, like jarred cherry pie filling. Flavor has some nice cherry pie sweetness and apple pie savoriness, but what really makes this is the medium cranberry tartness to balance it out. Tart up front, sweet out back. Lip smacking. The fruits are doing a nice dance here! The cranberry brings an otherwise very good sweet fruit beer into an excellent tart and sweet ale!
Nice fruit beer.  It is sweet so share it with a couple people.  Flavor of red plums and apples.  Another great fruit beer from New Glarus.

750ml bottle poured into an english pint. Pours a brownish red with minimal head. Aroma is super fruity. Apples, cranberries, cherries. It almost reminds me of one of those tri-colored frozen ice things you get at the county fair. Taste is medium sour and light sweet. Tart cherries, cranberry, apples and other fruits. Medium bodied with a thick and sticky texture. Lively carbonation and a super long finish. Overall, awesome.

Poured a lovely, sparkling clear red with a small but moderately durable red-tan head that left the glass nicely coated when tipped.  [4.5]
 
Has a very fruity aroma; tart. Appealing yet it didnt prepare me for the magnificent taste.  The flavor is loaded with mixed fruit, with both cranberries and cherries evident.  Perfect TART/sweet balance. 

The medium-light body is lively yet creamy smooth. 

O: as good as any fruit beer Ive ever had, including the finest Belgian lambics.

Bottle via trade. This is one of the best fruit beers I have ever had hands down. Appearance its an ugly brown/red color with a small to average white tight foamy head. Aroma is loads of fresh fruits, cherry and apple, some pie crust and graham cracker. Medium to slightly thinner bodied with average carbonation. Flavor is the same as the aroma with a great apple and cherry combo along with pie crust and a slight touch of cranberry. When it comes to fruit beers no one is even close to New Glarus.

Poured from a bottle from last October (aged perfectly in the closet of my apartment lol).  Brownish Red color with a nice thick head.  Smelled of apples and cranberries, and had an excellent fruity taste! Honestly the best beer I've had from NG, and one of the best beers I've ever had! Can't wait to get it again next fall!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap @ the brewery. Pour is reddish. Aroma of cranberry, apple, and cherry. Slightly tart but sweet. Great offering.

Deep reddish brown, thin cream head. Aroma is cherry, Apple, blueberry, cranberry, sour, funk. Taste is sweet and sour cherries, cranberries, a background of green Apple, a hint of blueberry. Slightly dry, crisp on the finish.
Another New Glarus sour fruit knockout. Lots of cranberry flavors. Good slightly tart finish, sweet but not cloying. Light and very refreshing. Just a bit of funk.

Thanks go out to Ri0 for this bottle!

A- A dark red colour, big head of foam that shrinks down quickly but leaves some nice lacing behind.

S- As soon as I popped the cap, the aromas literally permeated the area around me. Big green apples and sweet cherries every darn where...ooh..I am SO digging it. I could almost hover my nose over the glass for hours but...its time to take a sip or 2, eh?

T- Oh my! The apples and cherries are there as expected but better executed than even I expected(not my first venture into NG Fruit/Vegetable beers) and then Im hit with a mild cranberry tartness. Whoah, Nellie, this brew kills it!

M- Medium bodied, carbonation light until near/at/after the swallow where it perks up a bit. MF, like everything else screams nectar of the gods.

O- From my past track record for NG brews, I had high expectations. Those expectations were exceeded! Marvelous true Session beer!

Shared thanks to Dave. Pours out an attractive reddish colors with a small white head. Aroma is of fruity soda, some apple, cranberry, cherry, light syrup. Taste is complex, lots of layers of fruity goodness, sweet apple, fresh cranberry, light tartness, cherries, sweet berry, apple pie. This is really well done!
Super good. Not a normal fruity beer fan but this breaks the rules. Straight up raspberries but not too sweet.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours reddish brown with a delightful mixed fruit aroma. There is a delicious berry/cherry flavor with plenty of carbonation and a tart finish. Quite complex with an oaky presence.
750ml bottle @dmacs shared by dmac-thin offwhite-amber with orange tint.  A-sweet cherry, sugar.  Sweet cherry, sugar, spice.

Bottle from Guerde! Many thanks for a 100!!! Pours dark copper /amber. Aroma is rather fresh berry. Fruits du bois. Med body. Flavor is tart mixed berry - some cherry for sure. Its extremely delicious.

750 ml bottle, shared with friends on a rooftop deck on one of the first really nice spring days in Seattle.  Pours clear, reddish brown (I hear thats called burgundy, which sounds much more attractive than the way I just put it).  Off white head, some retention, very little lacing.  Aroma of ripe fruit - apples, cranberries, and cherries (surprise surprise).  They blend beautifully, the smell is lush, ripe and inviting.  Taste is sweet, fruity, slightly tart -- theres a lot more complexity to this on the nose and tongue than I can articulate, which leaves me a little frustrated that I cant have more to try to sort it out (damn you, Wisconsin, for being so far away!).  Medium body, average carbonation, creamy texture.  Delightful all around.

22oz Bottle A - Pours a browhish red with a small head that dissipates quickly. Mild lacing. S - Pungent cherries! Some creamy malt as while. T - Cherries and more cherries with apples in the background. Oaks notes particularly vanilla. M - Light bodied. Tingling fizz. Mouth watering. Sweat/tart finish. O - Love the Fruit Ale category, but hard for me to call this a beer. Never the less, Delightful!

his is easily one of the best fruit beers that Ive ever had and one of the finest that New Glarus has ever created! This is right at the top of the list with the Belgian Red and the Raspberry Tart. I really enjoyed the combination of sweet red fruit, oak, vanilla and the slight sour character the most in Serendipity. I highly recommend and suggest going out and getting this if youre a fan of NG fruit ales and if you live in Wisconsin or live near the border.

aroma is cherry and cranberry, mostly cherry though. looks brownish red with slight purple hue. taste is very cherry with apple asserting itself as well. cranberry seems to link the two more than anything. smooth with a slight viscosity.
...and now back to our regularly scheduled Slutfest ratings.  Medium reddish amber.  Aroma is apple, slight cherry.  Flavor is a match - almost like a soda, just a touch sour.  Really, really nice.
Slutfest 2013: Cherry jolly ranchers aroma, green apple too. Copper, thick yellow head. Cherry, green apple candi flavor. Mouthfeel is a bot harsh. Extra delicious, but not very beery.

Slightly cloudy amber pour with a finger of khaki head. Nose is incredibly fruit forward. Tons of cherry and cranberry. A light tartness, some apple, and sweet fruit syrup. Great cherry flavor to this. Lightly tart, which balances the sweetness nicely. Good cranberry notes, some apple, and a hint of lemon. Mild vanilla, oak, and fruit syrup.
Bottle. Rating #223. Great beer, sweet fruits, all three meld really well. Wish I had a few more bottles. (2671)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text:
Bottle shared at Slutfest 4. Pours a clear red 

color with a thin tan head. Fair head retention. 

Aroma of apples and berries, light tartness and 

a very faint herbal note. The taste is 

strawberries, cherries, apples, mild earthiness. 

Medium bodied.
Ar: cranberries,  peach, crab apple, cherry, and subtle whiskey.  Red-orange with small, white head.  Tart, fruity, slightly sweet, and funky.  Light bodied and very refreshing.
Sampled at Slutfest 4 - Sexytime!  Amazingly great tasting and smelling brew.  Sweet and crisp with enough sour cherry and cranberry for balance.  Really awesome.  My fave of the tasting thus far!

Gigantic thanks to travlr for saving a bottle of this for me! Beautiful crimson pour with a bubbly white head that dissipates quickly. Nose holds a breaktaking combination of slightly tart apple juice, zippy cranberry, and sweet cherry. Gorgeous rich oaken vanilla adds to the complex sweetness. Reminiscent of Selins Groves kriek, but with the expected broader melange of fruit characteristics, and more oak character. Nuanced but easy-drinking, crisp effervescence. Absolutely delightful.

22 ounce bottle, shared among 5 people. Aroma is tart cranberry pie, very sweet. Appearance is a liquidy, fizzy, clear, foamy bright red. Taste is very tart, sweet cherries, cranberries, jolly rancher candy. Palate is highly carbonated, light bodied, pungent in your mouth.  Overall its a great fruit beer, big flavored and distinct. This is a good choice for those who like sweet table wines, or for those who normally dont care for the traditional beer flavor.

Nose is strong for cherries initially, then apple, then cranberry, they all take their turn. Very sweet into the mouth, recedes a little on the swallow, which has a crisp finish. Even a little sweeter than I was expecting, but was pleasant.  Might think about combining it with a chocolate stout as I have had a youngs double chocolate stout combined with a lambic in the past which was very good.

Big thanks to Adam for hooking me up! I am now more of a New Glarus fanboy than I already was. Vibrant, wine-dark reddish pour with the same tight carbonation from NGs other fruit beers. Immediate impression on the nose is a pleasant rush of memory when encountering that deliciously distinctive oak quality Dan Carey gets with his fruit beers. Glorious mix of sweetness and tartness in the nose, deep ripe cherry, tart apple, and dried cran (the latter more prominent the further you linger over this beer). Taste is slightly more tart than sweet, though still exquisitely balanced. Hints of malts and fruitbread peek through, but its mostly just content to linger at the oaky intersection of these three fruits. A triumph.

Leave it to Dan Carey at New Glarus to take a bad cherry harvest, an okay apple harvest, and a great cranberry harvest, mix all those together and get a wonderful beer accident that only he can produce! Behold, Serendipity! A sour fruit beer that shows the skill of the brewmaster and also makes the beer drinker yearn for more from this great brewery (www.newglarusbrewing.com). While Spotted Cow seems to be the most recognizable of the brews that New Glarus produces, and it definitely has its place, they push out much more great beer than that. If youve never had their Double IPA, Raspberry Tart, Belgian Red, Black Top, Moon Man, Enigma and many more, its time to run up to Platteville or even head to Madison or New Glarus itself to check out more of their products.

Serendipity is considered a fruit/sour beer and you can definitely get the tartness from this brew. The flavors of all the fruits really do a number on your taste buds, and the beer pairs perfectly with brownies, chocolate cake, or even makes a great dessert on its own.

750ml bottle. Fresh raspberry malt aroma. Hazy, brown amber body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Raspberry, Cherry and cranberrie fresh fruit flavor has a lingering fruity aftertaste. Medium body. Delicious.

750ml bottle pours a clear copper amber with some fluffy, slightly off white head.  Nose has a mix of fruit, apples, cherries, pears, cranberry, its of fruit juice.  Flavor is crisp apple juice, dried cherry, raisin, lightly tart, a little malt lurking but this is like drinking sparkling apple cider with fruit mixed in.  Not at all sour.  Sublimely drinkable.  Refreshing.

750 ml green bottle poured a clear reddish amber with a small lingering amber head. Aromas of cherries, cranberry, straw, spice and light apple. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of cherry, cranberry, spice, cookie and apple with a crisp dry lingering fruity finish. WOW! This one beats Red and Tart hands down!

Tailgater at Keystone for last day of the ski season.  Nice reddish brown with fast fading head but moderate lace.  Big fruit nose of apples and red fruit and oak.  Could just happily smell this for a long while.  Taste follows...just huge fruit.  Mostly apple then cran.  Sweet then a nice tart pucker.  Very reminiscent of the Cranbic they did.  Nobody does fruit beer like these guys.

Ruby red with a red tinged head. Im getting strong cherry, apple and cranberry in the nose. The flavor is a rich sweet and sour mixture of apples, cherry and cranberry. Body is slightly heavy and the slight carbonation gives off a crisp feel. Next time Im in Wisconsin, Ill be getting more than one bottle of this because this is absolutely amazing!
Pours ruby red with a pink light head. Smells of fruit, some tarte undertones. tastes of cranberry cocktail with a spritz of carbonation and apple juice. Way too sweet.

25 oz bottle.  Clear garnet with lacy froth.  Nose is very sweet cherry and apple with slight yeast.  Crisp and juicy with sparkling carb and a sticky pucker.  Taste is cherry, apple and vanilla with the cranberry adding a perfect sour foil to the fruity sweetness.  Somewhere between champagne, hard cider and Cran-apple.

Damn!  All the fruits in this beer are well
Represented and and play together nicely.  Typical New Glarus fruit beer.  Amazing aroma and flavor.  No imagination needed, dive in to mound cranberry & apples. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rating #1600. Bottle courtesy of GhostFace, cheers!! Shared at the March 2013 tasting in Santa Cruz. Pours a dazzling ruby amber color with a disappearing white fizz. Explosive cherry aroma with some sharp tartness to it, immediately similar to Jolly Ranchers. Flavor is revelatory, as is the case with most NG fruit beers. An absolute barrage of concentrated fruit madness. Cherries make up the major flavor component, candy-sweet but natural-tasting, with a base of ice cider apple flesh and a perfect cranberry bite on the finish, rounding out the immense sweetness with a divine tartness. This is easily on par with Belgian Red et. al. and arguably better, due to the complexity and synergy thereof. Serendipity indeed.

Clear red/ burgundy color wiht a medium  disappearing off--white head.  Aroma is red apple with some funky notes and strawberry. Flavor is deep apple tartness, mix of apple juice, vinegar and raspberry, fantastic, unlike anything I have drank before very gentle aftertaste with a pleasant raspberry linger. Palate is light to medium, extremely flavorful, drinkable and refreshing. Outstanding, I wish I had regular access to this stuff.

Bottle shared by Adam, thanks! Pours a clear amber with a slight orange hue with a light brown head that starts and remains at the edges. Aroma has a good amount of slightly tart cranberry with a bit of sweet apple underlying. Flavor has a syrupy cranberry note with a bit of apple that is slightly sweet.

Reddish-brown pour with a light tan head. Aroma is dominated by the cherry. This beer is so tasty. I want more. A mish mash of 3 fruits that dance across your tongue waking up your taste buds. Tartness of cranberries and cherries liger after the first sip. Faint sourness combines the 3 fruits into one deliscious cornecopia of goodness. Cleansing aftertaste. Nice lacing. By far, one of my favorite fruit beers.

Dark red, off-white/light pink. Bubbly carbonation. Nice transition from the color of the beer to its head. Nose is a big box of crayons, cranberries, tart cherries. Taste is tart fresh cherries, cranberry, and then some apple sweetness in the finish. Lingering yogurt and tart fruit. Very light and dry, super quaffable.

Bottle. Pours dark ruby with a big off-white head that leaves almost no lacing. Aroma is cherry skins, sour apples and a hint of the cranberry. Taste is wonderfully complex. A constant tug of war emerges between the sweetness from the cherry and the sour from the apple/cranberry. The cranberry is most apparent in the finish. Oak makes a late appearance. It's not super apparent but it adds a nice layer to the complexity. Mouthfeel is full and carb is lively. This is an incredible brew. It's so unique and all of the disparate elements are tied together so well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A burgundy ale with a thin off white head. In aroma, a beautiful candy apple, with strawberries jam, sour notes from cranberry. In mouth, a sweet soda like apple jam with light cinnamon, acidic notes,warming alcohol, very nice. Shared with GRM, Pushkinwow, and Ian, March 8 2013.

Sampled thanks to Lubierre, probably one of my favourite beers of the night. Redish brown, hazy, biege head. First impression brings my back to childhood and sour green apple jolly ranchers with some cherry components...could break it down but that is essentially that this was for me...and seeing as I loved those as a child it was a good things for me (although probably biased). Full body, moderate carbonation, get a bit of cranberry on the palate, then the apple and some cherry overwhelm but in a good way. Wow did I like this - thanks Luc for bringing this one out. Would gladly buy a case of this one.

Light and sour aroma, I can smell hints of apple. Light brown and and clear. Had an enjoyable blend of fruity flavors and a sour palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is sweet and apple filled, almost like candy but light enough to be all apple. Appearance is a nice clear red. Taste is sweet apple with some sour edge. Almost too sweet, damaging drinkability, but very enjoyable. Has a nice level of carbonation.

Bottle tnx to Paul. Pours clear dark amber with a great creamy beige head. Aroma is sweet fruity berry fresh refreshing and crispy; fantastic. Flavor is velvety berry fruity a bit malty a bit tart and acidy and sour. Finishes sourish berry. Excellent.

Bottle thanks to jer. Pours with a clear reddish hued body with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of Ocean Breeze Cranberry Cocktail, cherry and apple. Quite sweet smelling and almost all fruit. Flavors are apple, dark cherries, sweet, some cinnamon like flavors, pie. Canned/caramelized pineapple. Very sweet. Lively carbonation, massive body, stick finish, with not quite enough acidity to keep it from being cloying.

Holy Fruit Bomb ! Pours a deep ruby brownish color with a equally strange colored pink grey head. The nose is full of harvest fruit apple, cherry, cranberry, grape juice, a touch of vanilla and oak as well. The palate is sweeter than I expected and very juicy. Big fruit that is in your face when served cold but mellows out slightly as it warms to room temp. As it warms more acidity emerges with some darker fruit funk appearing in the finish. Nice beer but a little to sweet. Thanks JStax !

750 ml bottle

If this is a temporary replacement for Belgian Red I hope that it sticks around a bit longer. This is right up there with Raspberry Tart as a world class sour fruit beer. Before it disappears from the shelves I am going to pick up a few more for the cellar.

Aroma / Appearance - A purplish red body shimmers and glows. The red edges give the color of a setting sun. Dirty white flecks of head and soft legs give it just the right amount of depth. Cranberries, apples, and cherry fruit pie sweeten the air like the judging table at a county fair.This is a blend of a candy store and an orchard.

Flavor / Palate - Cranberries and apples are sweet on the tip of the tongue. The tang that hangs in the back of the throat is like a sharp lemonade. From start to finish this is a great balance between sweet and sour. Until Belgian Red comes back this is a fine substitute.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Bomber from Casanova. Wow, I love this. Better than the Raspberry Tart and Belgian Red for me. Awesome apple, cranberry, and cherry. The flavor explodes and isnt overly tart or sour. Phenomenal!
Sweet fruity cherry apple cranbery notes delicious nose. Red pour nice hrad. Sweet fresh fruity flavora lots of cherry apple and cranberry. Smooth fruitu awesome.
From the bottle, nice red pour with a white head.  Aroma of tart fruit including cranberries, taste is a good mix of the apples, cranberries, and cherries.  One excellent beer!!!!
Poured from a 750ml bottle.  Cherry Lifesavers, cherry, apples, slight syrup, tart. NG nails another fruit beer.

Bottle, courtesy Brigadier, thanks! Dark ruby pour, big white head, good retention/lace. Aroma of cranberry, apple, sour cherry, raspberry, light barrel. Taste tart upfront, then sweeter, sour cherry, cranberry, apple, light barrel, light cola. Palate is soft, slick, sweet fruity finish. Really nice all around.

shared at canellas bottle share last night poured a huey redish ,golden red the smell of this beer will make a grown man weep this thing smelled like candy fresh fruit red vine twislers if you will then its all a crazy fruit explosion woody and vanilla nice carb it was greeeeat

Originally reviewed: 11/20/12. Thanks to my brother for sending a couple bottles of this my way! One for now, one for Thanksgiving dinner. Bottle split and shared with a friend. Poured into a small wine glass. 

Pours a dark tawny-tinted red with a pinkish head on top. The nose, the nose, my kingdom for the nose! Cherry jolly ranchers. Need I say more? Such a fruity and tart aroma, I cant think of a better way to describe it. Nothing really stands out much different than the BR or RT, but thats not necessarily a bad thing. 

Effervescent bubbles give this beer life! Crisp and bubbly - fits this beer to perfection. Big flavors of cherries and apples. The cranberries really show up on this finish as this tarts up quite nicely. This sets itself apart from the other fruity mainstays from these guys. Its sweet, no doubt, some would say too sweet. But the tartness comes through at the right moment, giving a nice kick to the back end. I think Id be able to get through a bottle of this one my own, but I find it is the perfect beer to share. Sweet. Tart. Tasty. Thank you, Dan. You work quite the magic with some fruit.

Bottle shared by badnewsbeers. Clear red-brown body, medium tight dirty pinkish cream head. Tart, sweet nose, grassy and dusty, fruity and rich. Sharp, sweet body, with tart apple (especially), cranberry, and cherry; grassy and yeasty. Slightly medicinal. Crisp, rich, and delicious.

Pours amber brown with a small light beige, almost peach colored head. Smells strongly of fruits, reminiscent of apples, cranberries, and cherries. Taste is fruity, sweet, and tart all at once; a hint of cherry up front that moves to cranberry tartness and finishes with strong apple and apple skin flavors. Light-to-medium bodied with a lightly prickly texture and fizzy mouth-carbonation, New Glarus Serendipity finishes with a soft tart dryness.

Bottle from Ghostface.. thank you. Pour is ruby red with some nice light white head. Moderate lacing and a nice white collar left after a minute or two. Aroma of ripe cranberry, yellow apple, some peach and white grapes. Taste is same with a good amount of carbonation. Sweet cranberry lasting on the finish. Finish is slightly dry. Like a sparkling cranberry apple spritzer. Overall another win from New Glarus.

750ml bottle in a tulip.  Pours the color that the blend of those three fruits should be in a beer, a nice ruby with a pink/tan head.  Aroma of cherries, cranberries, hints of apple, some light oak, and a nice spiciness.  The flavor is a blend of fruits that is balanced very nicely by the beer.  Average texture.  A good beer, even if you dont like fruit beers.
Aroma of tart cherry, apple and a hint of cranberry.  The taste is pure fruit, with a nice tart finish.  There is a good amount of carbonation.  This beer tastes like really good sparkling juice.

Tasted at RBBWG 2013, thanks Travlr!
Pours a clear brilliant reddish brown color with a tan ring for a head. Smell is apple, cinnamon, cherry - a nose full of fruit. Big fruit taste - the aforementioned fruit ending nicely dry and crisp. Body is medium - round & slick with nice active carbonation. Another very tasty fruit brew from New Glarus.

Poured, in a wine glass, a clear rubby red - copper color with a very nice fine foam head with slowly faded to extensive lacing.  Aroma was fruity with malty sweetness in the background.  Taste was very fruity - cherries, cranberry tart and slight apple - with a malty backbone and a mild floral hop finish.  Palate was very nice.  Overall, another exceptional fruit beer offering from Dan at New Glarus!
user_location: Town of Maple Creek, Wisconsin, USA

text: 750mL bottle.  Poured fiery garnet with a dense-bubbled, easily-resuscitated khaki head.  The aroma picked up a tart blend of cherries and cranberries paired with a bit of oak and floral character.. great balance between sugars and tart character.  The flavor found tart cherries and apple skins on the tip of the tongue, with meatier apple following.. lively carbonation, tart cranberries, and oak surrounded.. finished tart over a lot of tasty, residual, fruity sugars.  Light-medium bodied with a lot of carbonation on the palate.. really dried out in the end.. great brew!
Bomber thanks to Ghostface. Pours ruby red with purple/white head. Great tart cranberries sweet cherries. Strong apple cranberry and cherry taste. Great beer

Bottle from Neal - thanks!  Clear reddish pour with a froth of white foam.  Aroma is apple, berries, sugary fruit, and light tart.  Taste is heavy with apple and cranberry and sugary fruit.  Clean, lightly coating mouthfeel.  Sugary but very good in small pours - I cannot imagine anyone really making better fruit beers than New Glarus.

bottle at RBBWG12 
pours very clear orange, / brown
no real foam
smell is apple , even soapy, but in a way very good ! 
taste is like liquid candy ! amazingly sweet, candy in aftertaste as well. so diffrent, i love it !

Pours a deep red with minimal head after pouring. Smells of tart cherry and apple. Tastes almost the same as it smells. Drinks very similar to theBelgian Red and the apple in it does nicely too even it out.

My Bottom Line:
Portentous cranberries and Montmorency cherries leap from the glass, sticking to the palate even after just one sip.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A crown of foam circles the clear garnet.
-The flavor profile is in line with the powerful aroma.
-This tastes like a super fruity soda of the best kind. But it doesnt have the drinkability. 
-Cranberries dont have the appeal of raspberries or cherries in beer, imho. But this will definitely please all those looking for an intensely fruity experience.
-Mild acidity accompanies the sugars in the finish.

Bottle.

I feel like forever who hasnt tried this beer be prepared... Doesnt have the slightest resemblance to beer IMO

Poured a cherry amber color with no head and very little carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, mix of cherries, crab Apple, cranberries, and a slight sourness which reminds me of being a kid working on an Apple orchard drinking fermented Apple cider.  My wife loved it, I wasnt in the mood for this on a cold snowy winter night but will give it another go in the summer
One of many New Glarus bottles courtesy of GhostFace. Deliciously sweet and tart, even in the aroma. Excellent balance and complexity.

12/24/12. 750mL bottle thanks to cbfobes! Mostly clear dark amber pour with a small khaki head that fades. Nice fruity aroma with touches of tartness that are distinctly loaded with cherry and a lesser bit of cranberry. Lightly tart flavor with lots of cherry, apple, and light cranberry. It reminds me of Jolly Ranchers in a way, but its damn good. Tasty!

19/I/13 - 1Pt. 9Fl. Oz. bottle @ RBBWG 2013 - BB: n/a (2013-36) Thanks to Travlr for sharing the bottle!
Clear ruby red to copper red beer, small irregular light pink head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: bit sour, cherry candy, cherry syrup, sugary. MF: little carbon, medium body. Taste: very fruity, sweet, cherry candy, syrup, bitter touch. Aftertaste: sugary, cherry candy, syrup, a lemony sour touch, more candy sweetness. Not much different from all the sweet Belgian "kriek" ales...

Pours red with a tan head that disappears quickly. Aroma is strong apple and cherry. Taste is tart and fruity but with a significant amount of sweetness, a little much for my taste. It has a medium body with and is a bit fizzy. Overall this is a great beer, wouldnt mind if it was a bit drier but if I had the opportunity in Chicago to purchase more of this I definitely would be.
Bottle shared with northropfrye. Luxurious cherry aroma. I could taste apples and cranberries. Beautifully sweet and tart, balanced exactly the way I like it. This beers a real treat.

Red maroon body with offwhite head, fades. Vibrant tart aroma of sweet cherries, some breadiness. Taste is also rather sour with nice sweet fruit. The one criticism I have of these New Glarus fruit beers, and it seems pretty consistent, is that the flavour fades very quickly. I would rate this higher if the flavour lingered a little bit, but it just doesnt. Too bad. Still very good, though.

Bottle generously shared by yourefragile. 

Pour yields a reddish-brown colored brew with a short fizzy head that recedes somewhat quickly. The nose carries a strong bit of cherry and cranberry as well as underlying earthiness. Some tartness coming through, as well as fruit skin. Flavor is moderately tart but has far too much underlying sweetness. Body is medium and appropriate, but theres too much residual sweetness coming through. Pretty nice for a fruit beer, but pales in comparison to Belgian Red and, to a lesser degree, Raspberry Tart.

Bottle from Dak.  Thanks my man.  Pours a clear red-brown color with a tannish head.  Aroma is cherry, apple and tart cranberry.  Taste is sweet and tart.  Medium bodied and sticky.  Another incredible fruit beer from New Glarus.  Better than Wisconsin Red?  Im not prepared to say that, but its certainly open for debate.  Nobody can touch NG when it comes to fruit beers.

Split a 750ml bottle. Poured a pretty clear ruby amber color with a light pink fuzzy head. Aroma was rich and fruity, some crisp apple, tart cranberry and a nice sweet cherry note to it. Flavor was just so freaking enjoyable. Highly drinkable, highly refreshing, and well balanced. This is a beer that would be enjoyed by non-beer drinkers and well as seasoned veterans.
Aroma of cherry throat losenge, apple cider, and slight black cherry.  Pours red with light head.  Taste is intense like a sweet cider.  Tart and fruity.  Good stuff!

4th January 2013THE stout tasting Pt1. Thanks to Bruce for this much wanted beer. Clear red - amber, little pale cream coloured head. Softish palate, slightly airy. Lovely sweet and sour fruity apples and pears nicely contrasted with tart cherry, strawberry and raspberry. A little sweet cream and then a soft finish. This was a joy of fruity zing after the triple Dark Lord attack!

Bottle. Sweet and fruity aroma, almost bubblegummy, with both apple and cherry evident. Not much head. Mostly clear, dark reddish amber body. The one fruit of the three that isnt as evident in the nose is the first you notice in the flavor with a tart cranberry finish. Really outstanding but is meant to be shared due to its sweetness.

Bottle post-The Stout Tasting Part I, London - many thanks to Bruce for keeping the party going! Pours clear purple with a fine white cream cap. Big tart grape and berry aroma, some raspberry. Big sweet flavor, fairly thick, some grapes. Medium to full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Big and juicy. Reminiscent of bug juice. Its kind of sugary. Still, really tasty.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2016 While I wasnt a big fan of the apple ale, I absolutely LOVE this brew.  The sweetness from the cherries and cranberries really come through in the finish and make it a lot more enjoyable to me

Delicious beer that can be appreciated by both the biggest beer geeks and those who dont enjoy beer at all.

The problem that we always run into when weve got this on hand is that its gone way too quickly.

Not as good as Wisconsin Belgian Red, but pretty darn good. Hopefully the drought will come to an end soon and Red will be back on the shelves in 2013.  Serendipity will have to hang with Raspberry Tart for now.

(750ml bottle) clear brilliant copper, effervescent. Nose of cherry, apple, urinal cakes, cinnamon, spicy candy. Taste of rich cherry syrup, cinnamon, apple pie, amazing and delicious. Complex but hard to even describe.

Clear red brown colour, slight white rim. Aroma of fruit, apple, cherry, red berries, caramel. Did I mention lots of fruits? Sweet fruity flavour. Sweet fruity finish, lots of apples and cherry.
Sweet, maybe too sweet, but still balanced. I can see the attraction of this, but wouldnt want to drink more than a small taster glass.
(From 75cL bottle @ RBBWG II. Courtesy of Travlr. Thanks Gene!)
Bottle. Clear ruby amber color, small tan coca cola head. Aroma of berries, cherries, lemon. Taste is mixed fruit.

Pours a dark pink/light red with white bubbly head. Aromas are cranberry sauce, sour cherries, and apple juice as it warms. Just as advertised. Like all new glarus fruit beers, bubbly and effervescent. Sour flavours...cherry and granny smith apples. Mild finish. Excellent. Fruity, fresh, awesome. Very glad I got to try this.

Poured I to a tulip a very clear dark red with a nice 1 finger white head. Aroma hits you with some huge fruit with tart cherries and apple. Taste follows th.e nose with Cherry up front followed by tart apples. My first thought was that I had a cherry jolly rancher. I cant help but appreciate how they turned this into a beer....incredible. Mouthfeel is light with a lot of carbonation that tingles the tongue. A very nice fruit beer to sip on and nothing else.

75cl bottle sample @ RBBWG 2013, courtesy of Travlr.
Cuivrée, col beige moyen.
Arôme est agréablement fruité avec un mélange distinct et perceptible de pomme, canneberge et cerise qui sentrechoquent pour un bouquet bien balancé. Pointe de malt et touche sucrée caramel le tout gardant un soupçon daigreur fruité.
Palais met bien en évidence les trois fruits énoncés sur létiquette. On ressent le côté râpeux de la pomme, et laigreur de la cerise et canneberge. Tout cela est accompagné dun malt subtile et une amertume houblonnée qui vient juste en retrait du profil des fruits. Malheureusement le tout conserve ce côté plus jus de fruits, limite du cidre. Reste agréable, mais un verre est suffisant.

Sur une échelle de points, je garde le Belgian Red et Raspeberry Tart devant avec la Serendipity en troisième.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2014 (20/01/2013) Thanks to Travlr for sharing this one. 75 cl. bottle sampled @ RBBWG 2013. Has the colour of red apples with a dash of copper. Smell is incredible, reminds me of a kind of candy I had as a kid, not sure of the name, pixie dust candy? Blended with very sweet red apples, non-tart cranberries, cherries, Taste is the before mentioned candy, cherry juice, sweet red apples, lots of candy sweetness, zero fruit acidity, raspberries, caramel, very sweet but not sugar sweet, more candy, Body like air crazily good damn. I could drink just so much of this. //////////////////////////////////////// Had this again thanks to JefVerstraete - totally overrated the first time around, this is just candy / sugar etc. very sweet, fun first time but quickly becomes a chore. I do not get why this is rated so high this lemonade & I love sweet candy things like this but this tastes almost like some macro chemical fruit beers.

Bottle, pours clean brown-red with light night sky head, tons of vinous, vanilla fruit aroma, fantastic sweet vanilla fruit, at the point of cloingy but  doesn;t exceed the threshold,  really a fantastic brew

Sampled from bottle @ RBBWG 2013. Clear mahogany red color, small off-white head. Aroma and taste are very very sweet, some chemical cherries and an incredible amount of fruit. Not my thing Im afraid.
Pours a ruby red color, little head.  Aroma is sweet with cherries, apple and citrus. This is a very good beer to serve for the Holidays.  Love it.

Courtesy of Skyview.  Dark red color with a large head.  Aroma of cranberries and cinnamon.  Tart cranberry flavor with a decent showing of cherries.  Pretty sweet.  More reminicent of their Cran-bic than Belgian Red, which is not a bad thing.

Deep red with a slight, tan head.
Aroma of cherry, apple....rich, yet light.
Wonderfully full sweetness, cranberry, apple, cherry...spiced.
Bold, remarkably natural flavours.
A pleasure.

750 ml. bottle.  Thanks Jeff!  Pours a nice muted red with a slightly pink head.  Nice aroma of cherries and cranberries.  Taste is sweet cherries, tart cranberries, apples, and wood.  Starts sweet and finishes tart.  Excellent, excellent.

Bottle shared at SL via Tara... Light purple tint, small head. Great nose on this beer. Smells like raspberry/cherry pie. Taste reminds me of the raspberry tart....just a little lighter body wise. Tons of cherries, light apple notes. Sweet but not sugary. Body has an oily base with a good amount of carbonation. Overall.... really enjoyed this beer. Wish I had more. I could drink this all the time

Picked up a 750 ml bottle at Discount Liquors in Waukesha, WI. Pours a ruby red caramel colored brew with a thin beige head that quickly dissipates to a film top and minimal lacing. Aroma of both tart and sweet berries, some light caramel malt, almond marzipan, and some rosé wine. Taste is medium bodied, both sweet and tart berries, some light apple and some tart spice. Finish is a touch on the sweet side, with aftertaste of berries, apples and tart cranberries. A touch fruitier than the regular Belgian Red but still would drink this anytime.

Bottle.  Pours more ruby than brown with minimal head.  Smell is cherries, apples with a light sweetness.  Taste is mixed fruit juice of apple raspberries, and cherries.  Slight marzipan, medium tart, refreshingly dry.  Fantastic mistake indeed.  I could drink this all day and at 5% it could be quite possible.

Yeah it is stupid good, yeah it tastes like fruit juice, and yeah you should get this while you can.  It is all of the good about Belgian Red with a mixed complexity of fruits, slight oakiness, and just tart enough to pucker before a wash of fruit sugar to finish.

Bottle from Brent shared at toms, pours light ruby red color with some  head. Nose is beautifu cherry pie, i can even smell the crust first sipfloor is Luden cough drop, apple juice, and blueberry craisins. finish is rose champagne, great mouth feel. amazing
Very good fruit beer. honestly tastes like a jolly rancher candy. Sweet taste of cherries, with a tart bite on your tounge.

750ml bottle from Atom, thanks Adam! Pours a clear, rich red-copper colored body with a finger-width, dense and frothy, light tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is sweet cranberries and cherries with a light apple. Just a slight tartness and wood behind the rich, sweet fruits. Flavor is similar. Sweet cranberries and cherries with a nice, light apple essence. Just a slight wood element toward the end with a really nice, light tartness that helps this finish dry and clean with plenty of rich, sweet fruits lingering in a lengthy aftertaste. Light, very smooth and soft body with a crisp, soft, medium-light carbonation. Overall, this is extremely well done and delicious. Such a nice, rich, sweet fruit mixture that is balanced with a light tartness and wood note. So simple, but so effective. Just awesome.

Bottle after the carnage of THE Stout Tasting. Cheers to deeblo for sharing! The pours deep red with a tiny head. The nose is apple pie, cranberry juice, fruit punch, general sweet fruits. The taste is much the same. Nice, jammy sweet fruit flavors. Strawberry, apple, cranberry. Soft body. Really light, refreshing stuff. Vibrant. This is the best New Glarus beer Ive had.

[Bottle] Ive had this a couple of times now, and Ive failed to take really thorough notes either time. These terse notes will therefore be in need of a re-rate from one of my remaining bottles. Pours red with a nice off-white head. Aroma is big on cranberry. Cranberry and cherry are integrated beautifully in the taste. Medium-thin mouthfeel. Wow. I am a sucker for cranberry beers in general, and I love New Glarus, so unsurprisingly this was a big winner for me. Thanks for sharing the initial bottle I tried, Guerde!

750ml bottle, shared by Caterwaul. Really amazing nose. Like a fruity yankee candle, without the wax. Awesome cherry, grape, apple nose. Light sweet taste, but not cloying at all, very nice appropriate taste. Spicy yeast note works well to balance the fruit. Clear red / orange color. Good thin retaining off-white / slightly pink head. Great lace. Medium light body, light carbonation, kind of dry finish. Excellent fruit beer.

Bottle.  Dark cranberry colored pour, a little light lacing/carbonation and an aroma of tart cran-apple juice.  Flavor a perfect meld of apples, cranberries and tart cherrries, really nice tart crisp (almost dry) finish.You really cant do better than this when it comes to fruit beers, almost perfect.

Holy cow.  This is incredible.  I heard rumors upon my return to Wisconsin that my favorite brewery, the fabled New Glarus Brewing Co., had produced a special seasonal fruit beer.  After savoring their Belgian Red and Raspberry Tart beers for many years, I knew I had to try it.  Then, lo and behold, I received it as a Christmas gift from my grandmother.  Yes!  

It pours a beautiful ruby color with a thick off-white head.  Significant lacing, too.  Aroma is a lovely blend of apples, cranberries, and cherries.  The flavor is very fruity, with apples up front, and cherry/berry flavors at the end.  Its very similar to Belgian Red, but more complex.  The apples give it additional sweetness, but the cranberries add a tart flavor.  Sorry Belgian Red and Raspberry Tart, but this might just be my new favorite New Glarus fruit beer!

I paired this with a nice buttery Wisconsin gouda cheese and had myself a little snack earlier.  Mmmm...

Bottle-thanks to my good friend Laura for sending me this one from WI-pours cranberry red hue-looks amazing!  pink red head with some sparse lacing-nose is vanilla, apples, cranberries, tart cherries, very tart flavors of vanilla, cherries, ripe red apples, tart cheese (sharp cheddar).  long tart and cheese finish.  WOW this is awesome!  palate is lite with sprtizy carbonation from the wood aging and seems to be a norm for the brewery on their fruit beers.  I think this is the ultimate fruit beer!  It doesnt get much better than this!

750 ml bottle as a Christmas gift from my aunt-in-law from Madison. Thanks, Gretchen! Pours a clear ruby red with an inch of tinted off-white head. Aroma of cherry, cranberry, apple, currants, oak, and sweet malts. Flavor hits the same notes. Light-medium bodied, with medium carbonation and a sweet, tannic, tangy mouthfeel with minimal tartness. Really nice fruit beer. Drinks a lot like Belgian Red. So well done.

Bottle thanks to deeblo after a night of big stouts! It pours deep ruby-red with a small off-white head. The nose is tangy fruit.... apple, cranberry, cherry, blueberry, light oak and some tartness. The taste is tart fruit, jam, tangy berry (cranberry and blackberry), apple, marzipan, vanilla and light oak with a dry, tart finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and slightly sticky mouth-feel. Nice fruity sourness. Fairly straight-forward, but tasty and very well balanced. This beats Belgian Red & Raspberry Tart in my book.

Fruits galore!  Cranberries, apples, cherries, and even some blueberry notes to top it off.  Minimal tartness makes this brew imminently sessionable.  A clear step above both previous NG fruited beers, and a helluva value at $9/bottle.

Read great things about this elsewhere, and it did not disappoint. The big cherry aroma gets revealed after a pretty pour with a fluffy, reddish-hued head. The taste does a quick flip from sweet to tartly sour, and the real star is the long, luscious finish that clearly goes from cherries to apples to cranberries.

Bottle. Pour is reddish amber with medium off white head.   Aroma loaded with apple, cream soda, light tart notes, and faint pie spice. Flavor very true to nose with apple, really nice sweet tart notes, and a really nice ginger ale note. Great.

Bottle This beer rocks! Clear burnt-orange ale with ruby highlights and a large, frothy, off-white head. The bouquet rivals that of Belgian Red  cherries, graham, caramel crème, vanilla and a faint note of black currant. Medium to full-bodied with lazy carbonation. The flavor is so very fruity  cherries, currants and cranberries. Moderate sweetness and modest tartness mingle nicely with a mild, tannic bitterness undoubtedly provided by the cranberries. A subtle - yet luxuriant - swirl of vanilla, toasted oak, brown sugar and caramel cannot be ignored. Really just a fantastic balancing act here. Lightly sweet, tangy, cherry finish capped by a gentle feel of cranberry raspiness. This holds its own - right up there with Belgian Red and Raspberry Tart. Kick ass fruit beer!
Bottle pour on Christmas eve into a flute. $9.49 per 750mL. Way "tart"er than the other two NG fruit beers. High carbonation. I put this one behind Wisconsin Red and ahead of Raspberry Tart.

Light crimson, subtle scarlet, faint garnet, and moderate mauve with a cotton candy head.  Bright cranberry, tart cherry skin, and crisp apple with graham cracker, spicy cinnamon, oak, vanilla, brown sugar, and caramel.  Also some sweet balsamic...bit of sour.  Quite delicious and fairly complex.  Loved it!

This poured a ruby red color with a pinkish head.  Aroam was cranapple juice, with llight cherries mixed in too.  Flavor was predominantly cranberries and cherries, with light apples skins in the back.  Light and spritzy, yet loaded with flavor.  Another awesome fruit beer by New Glarus.

excellent new fruit beer that is inline with the Red and Tart, but this adds a ton of depth and complexity with a tartness that isnt present in the others as they are mostly sweet, cranberries show excellently, I will search out more cranberry beers

Clear copper with a creamy tan head.  Aroma of apple, cherry, spices and bready malt.  Taste is tart with cranberries, cherries, apple skins, spices and a touch of salt.  Not as good as Belgian Red but drinkable.

750mL bottle, pours a gorgeous fairly clear ruby red with a small beige head. Nose is a divine mixture of cherries, cranberries, perhaps other red berries and to a lesser extent, apples. Flavour is wonderfully complex, with the various fruits blending so well together, featuring notes of cranberries and cherries upfront, with the apple further back. No tartness and the sweetness is very restrained. The carbonation is suitably lively, sort of like a spritzer, which almost gives it a hint of spiciness, but more so in the mouthfeel rather than in the flavours. Remarkable stuff - New Glarus sure knows how to do their fruit beers. Raspberry Tart is still my favourite of the main three fruit beers.

Bottle. Pours a light reddish brown with a small white head. Aroma is super fruity, cranberry, apple, cherry a note of an earthy woodiness. Flavor starts sweet and mainly berry with a bit more apple coming along leaving more of a sweet and sour finish. Medium body and a crisp carbonation. Nice beer

First of all, thanks to cbfobes for offering this in his Free Beer Contest! This stuff is awesome. Smells fantastic - Each fruity aroma really pops, with nice notes of cherry, apple/pear, then cranberry. Hints of oak, too. Flavor is Fruity sweet with out being cloying, and like in the aroma, each flavor stands out. Insanely drinkable, not syrupy and all. I cant quite put my finger on it, but New Glarus always does a good job making a sweet fruity beer that still seems like a real beer and not some hack job experiment.

Ar:  Mostly berries on the aroma.  Cranberry seems to be the dominant fruit to me, with cherry having somewhat pronounced notes and apple fairly muted.
Ap: Pink-red, clear pour with a quickly dissipating head.
T:  Pretty sweet cranberry and cherry flavor with a touch of bitterness on the finish.  The finish is mildly tart, but I wish it had more of a punch.
P: Light, slightly sticky body with assertive carbonation.

O: Another excellent fruit beer from New Glarus.
Aroma of sour cranberry.  Dark red pour with a thin white head.  Flavor of sour berries, with a thinner, more bitter body than the other new glarus fruit ales.

Pours crystal clear red. Light pink foamy lace. Nose is bursting with cherries, apples, raspberries, nose tingling fruit intensities. Flavor is fresh squeezed juices, very mild spices mixed in. Fruit tartness is mild but present. Light body, medium dry. Nice and drinkable for a fruit beer.

Dark ruby red color with a light red fluffy head. Aroma is huge with apple, cranberry, and cherry sweetness. Some funk and sour notes are in the aroma. Medium body. Huge, huge sweetness from the fruits. The sourness is on the back end along with the oak notes. Very good and tasty.

Ruby pour with a medium tan head with hints of pink.
aroma is appetizing apple and cranberry juice. woody vanilla oakiness in there as well.
Flavour brings a bit more cherry tartness combining with cranberry. The apple so apparent on the nose doesnt feature as strongly in the flavour.  More of that oakey vanilla works behind the fruit nicely.
Sour and light berry sweetness play in the finish.

Bottle. Sweet black cherry, tart cranberry, and vanilla aroma. Clear pinkish amber with a large apricot head, nice lacing. Sweet cherry, light tart cranberry, and vanilla flavor with a slightly spicy finish. Medium body and carbonation. Wowzer!
Bottle.  Cherry and apple aroma with a hint of cinnamon.  Ruby red with small head.  Sweet blend of cherry, cranberry, and apple juice and malt flavor.  Light vanilla finish.  Very tasty.

Thanks a TON bauermj.  What a treat!  Absolutely gorgeous pour, deep ruby orange with a lively carbonation and two fingers of light beige tan head.  Nose is magical, smells like green apple jolly ranchers and a mulled cranberry cider. Candy-ish but acidic and lightly spicy. Hints of cherry and almond pit creep through as well.  One of the most incredible and engaging aromas Ive ever encountered. Oh man, this beer isnt even fair.. . spicy and tart flavor with a lot of fruit candy coming through and a wonderful acidity. Medium body and soft but crisp carbonation.

Bottle @ our annual Christmas night bottle share...  Poured clear, vibrant red with a mild, bubbly head. Aroma of candied malts and fruits. Tasted of cough drops, lifesavers, ring pops. Cherries, raspberries, cranberries came through.  Candied/artificial fruits and sweetness with a strong tartness. WTF.  Quite sweet and very meh. I dont understand the high score here.

Bottle:   Ruby in color, moderate to large frothy off-white head, nice lacing.   Huge fruity aroma, bright, big Cran-Apple aroma with hints of Cherry.   I dont know if you can get a fruit beer to smell so authentic and real, as if its got the fruit right in it.   Both sweet and tart on the tongue, Cherry, Apple, and Cranberry perfectly melded together.   Moderate to full body and mouthfeel.   Amazing balance, fruity that is both sweet and tart.   Happy Accidents are awesome!   Thanks to Ughsmash for getting me a few of these!   Simply awesome and real authentic Fruit Beer!
Bottle shared in Vail. Thanks to adnielsen for sharing. Pours a clear red color with white head. Cranberry, apple, cherry, slightly tart. Very fruity, pretty light bodied.
Bottle. Aroma is huge sweet and sour fruit. Pale pink with no head. Tart, very cherry forward with that classic new glarus pie sweetness. Light body, sharp but approachable.

Pours red-pink slightly copper color with mild but lively head, fuzzy. Aroma is a strong fermented fruit punch, can distinguish all 3 fruits.  Taste start  sweet moving into a strong tart-sour flavor but nice finish overall.  Lively carbonation.  Another great fruit beer!

Bottle.  A touch of soured cranberries backed by a rich jammy Apple and cherry mixture.  Great fruit character.  Complex fruit juice beer. Some tingling carbonation.  Nice body.  Not overly sweet.  Fun go drink.  Liked.

Pours a sparkling clear ruby with a foamy offwhite head that might even have a tint of red as well. Head diminshes to almost nothing quickly, and leaves almost no lacing. Aroma jumps at you with apples and cherries. Tastes tart, with plenty of apple and cranberry. Really great.

Bottle thanks to nuplastikk: Pours a clear ruby bronze with a large airy froth of off-white head.  Has a sweet and tart cherry nose with some fresh oaky notes and juicy apples.  Starts with good fullness and fine carbonation that brings the sweet apple and cherry notes out quickly giving way to tart cranberries and vinous oak before a slightly puckering finish.  Has nice complexity and tons of fruit flavor throughout.  This rivals all the other fruit beers they make.

Wow!!!! Unbelievable. The fruit ale pours ruby cranberry in color with a beautiful bright white head. The perfect aroma brings crisp apples, sweet cherries, and cranberries so pleasant in the nose. The flavor brings the sweet cherries and crisp apples with a cranberry base blended into both of the other fruits so nicely. A bit more carbonated than desired is the body, but doesnt take away from the brew as a whole at all. This beer is close to perfect.
Omg! Smells like fresh cut apples.  Overall its a pretty good fruit beer.  Wow¡ Its fantastic.

Great fruit beer, arguably better than the raspberry or cherry varieties from New Glarus.  A nice, sour funk with a great tart fruitiness to balance it out.  Josh brought this one back from WI for the winter beer tasting in Dec. 2012.

Bottle: Clear light red with an aroma that you just dont want to end.  All of the fruit you expect is in there plus sweet soda pop, gum, and light rubber.  Lightly acidic taste, tangy fruit punch that is so easy to drink.  This should be a must at every Thanksgiving and Christmas table!  Super tasty!

Bottle from brotha Daknole. Super clear copperish red with off white head. Aroma is crisp fresh chopped apples tangy cranberries and sparkling cider. Taste is awesome with an onslaught of fruit with a nice tart finish. So full of flavor for such low abv. Once again they nailed it!
Bottle. Pours amber with a thin head. Sweet cherry, berry, and apple, some woody funkyness, and medium acidity. Really damn good.

Bottle brought to Clockworks for his Dec 8th, 2012 tasting. Pours a deep ruby red with off white lacing/bubbles. Aroma is dusty apples, funk, cherries and light cranberry tartness. Mouthfeel is fruity with a nice short tart compliment in the back with notes of cherriers, sugary apple skins, light dusty funk and a very light cranberry tart finish. Yet another awesome fruit ale from NGB.

750 ml bottle. It pours a gem-like clear reddish copper color with a quickly disappearing off white head. The aroma is ultra fruity with tart red apples coming through strongest followed by sweet cherries and hints of cranberry and vanillins from the oak. Very mild, almost imperceptible oak character. Not very tart either, just fruity. The flavor follows suit with more sweet cherry that balances out the strong apple notes better than in the aroma. The cranberry is there, but I would have liked it to be stronger with some mouthwatering sour pucker, but no dice. It seems to have a better mouthfeel than Belgian Red. Not too syrupy. I probably would not have guessed this was oak aged. The fruit character is brilliant though. Vintage New Glarus. This probably ranks just above Belgian Red and just behind Raspberry Tart for me. Great, tasty beer.
Nice brown/amber color, aromatic and excellent finish. The fruits dance on your palette, just right carbonation, smooth drinkability. Definitely a mad science beer that works!

Bottle courtesy of Tooch4321.  Cheers, Adam!  Pours a mostly clear red-orange with a white head.  Nose is like blending cran-bic, apple ale, and Belgian Red.  Flavor follows with some mild apple cider character, some cranberry, and some Belgian Red.  Its like blending three awesome beers.  Light in body and pretty delicious.

Bottle courtesy of Jdadmond at a tasting at Jamess place.  Pours a clear brown with ruby highlights.  Smells of cherry coughdrops, in a very good way, apples, cherries.  Medium bodied, a little tart acid initially, sweet fruit.  Cherry, sweetness, apple and the faintest tart cranberry note.  Lovely tartness, acid and funk.  Really nice.

Bottle shared by Jredmond. Pours dark amber with an off white head. Nose is very fresh sugar apple, cranberry and cherry with some malt. Very strong and fresh. Taste is same, but slightly less. Medium body.

Appearance: Pours like (red) grape juice with a white ring of bubbles.

Aroma:  Sweet and tart cranberry juice cocktail, lovely oak. Grape skins.



Taste:  Sweet tangy cranberry juice cocktail, apple sweetness, tart cranberry. mild tannins, faint hop spice. Finiahes tangy.

Mouthfeel:  Juicy is an underatantement. Lively carbonarion. Full bodied.

Overall:  All I could think was this was grownup Martinellis juice. Its so delicious that I told Jonny I would drink a quart of this with breakfast every morning if I could. He agreed. The oak is in the backseat of all that fruit, but its there and makes this beer perfect.
750 thanks to khoffman43. Fruity all around. Cherry and cranberry and a bit of tart to the sweet.  Sparkling. Probably should have shared, but I was too curious.

Bottle thanks to Drew. Pours a bright reddish pink with a pink head. Nose is super fruity, Hi-C, apple and cherry. Faint cranberry cocktail with apple juice. Clean overall. Fruit cocktail. I really like the nose quite a lot. On tasting, it is very sweet. Fruit juice and Hi-C come through again, subtle tartness, malt is secondary. All about the fruit here. Finish is too sweet to drink a lot of, but still a well made beer. Not 4+.

Bottle thanks to Andrew.  Pours a dark red with a thin head.  Fruit cocktail nose of berries, apples, and cranberries.  Sweet berry, apple fruit flavors that are juicy and a little too sweet.  Im always open to try a new New Glarus fruit beer, but this was a little too much like fruit cocktail to me.

Pours a deep red/burgundy with nice pink head.  Aroma is cran-apple, light vanilla, and heaven.  Taste is notes of neil peart drum solos, Brian Boitano triple axels, and Daniel Day-Lewis monologues.  I cant get enough of this stuff.  Huge fruit flavor that drys out to a light tartness with medium sweetness on the finish.  TASTY

hazy red-tan, thin white large bubbled. Heavy cherry and green apple, very sugary. Flavor is lightly tart with sour candy, bit of sugar and apple mid bit of citrus and tart finish. Sticky body, light sugar through.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2012 Bottle. Poured a clear garnet color. The head was off white and reduced pretty quickly to a lasting film. Smelled very much like cherry juice with a splash of apple cider. Medium bodied and very sweet. Fruit juices with plenty of cherry and apple. Subdued mulling spices and a bit of tart cranberry at the end. Not a sour ale, per se, but if youre in the mood for a sweet fruit beer, this would be a good one. I expect it would be good with a nice blue cheese.

Happily crushed with Jakebra.  What a fucking beer!  Cranberries, cherries, and red apples.  Mostly apples in the flavor, tart fruit flavors.  The kind of beer where people say, "This is not a beer."  But it is.

I love the tartness from the cranberries.  This works for me especially when Ive had a hard day at work and need something to wake me up.  When you pour it into a glass there is a nice lacy head that quickly disappears.  The color reminds me of cherry soda/pop.  The carbonation combines nicely with the tartness.  You can taste the apples and cherries but the cranberries make this beer what it is.
Highly recommended.

Bottle via Atom, thanks Adam! Pours a dark amber to purple color with light pinkish head. Aroma is more cranberry and cherry forward with the apple coming in more when the beer warms a bit. Taste is slightly tart cherry to start, more sweetness followed by a bit of red apple with the cranberry coming in at the end to really make the tart factor come into play. I loved this beer as Ive loved pretty much all New Glarus fruit beer. This one is just under Belgian Red as my favorite.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Pours red with a thick Head of white and pink. Aroma consists of cranberry and apple juice. Hints of cherry, but relatively no sourness. Not nearly as sweet as the Belgian Red and somewhat tart at times.

75cl bottle, thanks nuplastikk.  Small off-white head atop crystal clear orange-red body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, cherry, cranberry, some orange, wood.  Taste is moderately sweet, cranberry, cherry, some tartness, faint wood.  Effervescent light-medium body, somewhat syrupy.

I can smell Apples, Cherries, & Cranberries. I dont smell or taste the oak that this brew was aged in. It has a tartness to it and the cherries leave a minimal taste after a sip but nicely fade away. Overall it is an above average fruit beer.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012  Big thanks to reynold314, huge cranberry and apple flavors, rediculous flavors, great apple aroma

Bottle, it is quite a happy accident, though im not totally sold on the mash of cranberry, apple and cherry.. I much prefer straight raspberry tart, the tartness here melds well with the cranberry and the sweetness of the apple balances well.. this is a truly awesome fruit beer, but one which i think the sum of its parts is not greater.

Bottle I brought back from Wisconsin to share with some friends.  Clear, dark red in color with a slight purple note.  Small foamy cap on top that has a light salmon color.  Aroma is well balanced between the cherry and cranberry, with a little bit of apple.  Really wonderful to smell.  Taste is balanced between apple, cranberry, and the cherries.  Maybe a bit more cranberry and tart apple than the cherries.  I pronounced tartness to this beer.  Absolutely wonderful fruit beer, that I prefer to the Belgian Red.  The tart aspects really make this beer special when compared to the sweetness of many of the other fruit beers from New Glarus.

Bottle with Chris and Ray.  Pours a really clean amber-red white off-white head that quickly receded.  Nose of cherries and freshly pressed apple juice.  Taste is like cran-apple juice, cherries, mild tartness.  Very well done.

Purchased at Breeze Thru Wine & Spirits in Wauwatosa, WI, enjoyed at a friends place while watching football before recording.  This is an exceptional fruit ale, very happy to have had this.  Appearance is a dark, relatively clear dark red with very little to no head, almost like a fruit juice.  Aroma is a rich, fruity amalgamation of cranberries, cherries, and apples, smells naturally sweet.  Taste is rather carbonated with sweetness from the cherries and tartness from the cranberries, starts off a little tart and finishes rather dry.  Not sure if its a phantom flavor, but Im getting a chocolate flavor as well.  This really is exceptional stuff and I like it more than the cherry ale.  Hope they do this again, probably not likely though.

I do not like fruit beers, but have learned what makes a quality one, mostly from my wife who loves them. Even for me this is good. It has a certain nostalgic holiday aroma and flavor from my childhood, maybe the cordial my mom would make out of crab apples, cranberries, a few red hots and vodka that wed all get to taste. Candy like but with a nice sour bite.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2013 Refrigerated 75 cl bottle poured into a white wine glass.  Pours clear red with orange and yellow highights at the bottom with small beige head.  Very good small bubble lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and cherry aroma.  Taste is sweet cherry, tart cranberry, and some apple.  Reminds me of there cherry beer.  Great beer.

Bottled sample. Red-brown cranberry in colour with medium cabronaition. Aromas are of candy apple, cherry Kool-aid, and earth. Flavors are akin to cherry candies, sour Granny Smith Apples, herbs, and a bit of wintergreen. Light bodied and easy to drink. Could use a touch more acidity, but pretty solid overall.

A fine beer to have for rating number 3100.  Pours deep brown with a bronze hue and tan head.  The aroma is a delicious fruit bomb.  It has tart cherries, green apples, raspberries, cranberries, pie filling aspect and is very smooth and rich, but there is enough tartness to keep things in check.  It has a medium / full body thats quite lush and has a nice amount of flowing sharp  carbonation.  The flavor starts with crisp fruitiness that balances well with the sweet and sour notes.  The apples, cherries and cranberries are all very much there and meld well without one overpowering the others.  There is a bit of oak and mild vanilla rounding things off with a pleasant smoothness.  This mainly comes out on the finish.  Excellent fruit beer from the folks that seem to do the best ones out there.

750 ml bottle. Big thanks to CLevar for sending me this one. Pours a dark ruby color. The aroma is like a fruit bowl. If you really think about you can identify all three fruits in there. Though it helps that I already knew what was what fruits were added to it. This is one of the better aromas for a fruit beer that I have had. The taste has loads of fruit but its really balanced without being overly sweet. This is a great fruit beer and probably the best Ive had from New Glarus.

Bottle courtesy of GT.  Pours a clear reddish brown with a than tan head.  Fruity nose, almost like Ocean Spray, but much fresher.  Notes of cherry, berries, and granny smith apples.  Flavor of cranberry juice with notes of raspberry and cherry.  Some apple notes as well.  Lightly tart.  Not bad.

Big sweet fruity nose, gobs of berry jam. Taste is moderately sweet, just lightly tart, fairly well balanced and it remains fairly drinkable.  Lots of berry, light caramel cream, some apple juice and light hibiscus. Finish is lightly tannic and bitter. Nicely done.

750mL thanks to nuplastikk! Clear deep jewel ruby pour. Thicker buttermilk foam. Nose is a tad medicinal but moving to old world fruit juice and General Store fruit candies, cranapple Ocean Spray, juicy juice box. Taste is classic NG blend of sweet juice, oil, tangy acid. Rich, quenching, ultra soft. Spicy acid backend. Another fruit beer masterpiece and beer work anomaly. Could give this beer to any human alive and not tell them what it is, they would love it, and then sit dumbfounded upon discovering this was indeed beer. Some may even take a long, hard look at their life and contemplate all the things they've been missing. Welcome to beer my friend.

Very very good.  Full review coming when I have a keyboard... Poop and stuff.

I suppose that after having this 4 times I should finally rate it.  The beer pours to a glowing red hued body with a mostly dissipating white head.  The aroma is sour cranberries, cherries, and subtle chocolate like a chocolate puffed rice with hazelnuts.  The flavor is mostly the same.  Sour cranberries and tart cherries up front that last for most of the life of the sip.  Then, near the end, it morphs into a light chocolate, puffed rice, and hazelnuts.  Oh so delicious and complex.  The palate is tart and coating.  Moderately bodied that it is substantial.  Super easy drinking.

750 ml bottle purchased at Woodmans Foods in Onalaska, Wisconsin.  The pour is a mostly clear reddish, auburn color with a one inch light tan head which fell fairly quickly.  The aroma is all fruit, a pleasant blend of cherry initially, tart green apple, and the cranberry below that.  As I get past the fruit, there is a soft oak, and a lightly spiced yeast.  Fresh fruit nose.  The taste is the big and bright fruitiness of the nose - especially the cherry and apple.  Cranberry lends some nice tartness to the back, though this is mostly about the big bright sweet fruit flavors.  The oak is only barely present, and the spice yeast of the nose makes an appearance briefly in the finish.  The palate is medium to light bodied, spritzy carbonation, and the lingering fruity tart yeast finish.  Very much a cousin of the Belgian Red, this is a nice Fruit Beer.

Courtesy of northernbrews
Bottle:  The aroma consists of moderate-heavy apple, tart cherry, cranberry, and a touch of cinnamon.  It pours a mostly transparent brownish-orange with a one finger beige head that quickly fades to a thin film.  Theres some spotty lacing left on the sides of the glass.  The flavor starts with a quick dose apples/cider with a touch of cinnamon.  The finish has sour cherry and cranberry.  Its medium bodied moderate carbonation. 750ml bottle.
Ruddy brown with some fluffy head.  Nose of tart and ripe fruit, oak - somehow able to pick the cranberries, apples, and cherries out yet they meld together wonderfully.  Dart and dry with a good amount of sour.  New Glarus makes the best fruit beers out there!

750 ml bottle shared by co-worker (Thanks Jason). Pours brown ruby red with a sudsy off white head that fades to a wispy film. Aroma is awesome tart sweet cranberries and apples. Taste is fruity tart cranberries apple and sour cherries with malt and  a subtle sour finish. Palate is medium slick and dry. F-ing awesome want to drink this non stop, until I get gut rot!

Clear ruby red pour with an off white head that fades fairly quickly. Amazing fruity aroma of cherries, apples, and berries. Taste is sweet and sour cherries, apples, grapes, and cranberries. Great puckering tartness to go along with the sweetness. Dry finish. Prickly carbonation. Phenomenal.
Bottle. Pours cranberry with thin lacing. Big fruit aroma sweet berries. Taste is sweet and sour fuck its good

Bottle from Simon. Red wine pour with medium off white head, lasted about 30 second to a minute. Not much lacing. Aroma up front is the cherry, then the cranberries come on strong finished with a subtle red apple skin scent. Taste is the most perfect and magical blend of three fruits, mostly the cherry comes through, then the apple in the aftertaste. Some further notes of ludens cough drops, wood, and other berry flavors. Perfectly tart and lightly sour. Medium to full body. Incredible.

Bottle shared with a few buddies. Well I knew New Glarus delivers some great fruit beers, but I didnt expect it to be this good. Fruit aroma right up front, sort of like smelling a cherry soda. Lots of apple in the flavor. Would be my absolute go to beer in the hot FL weather. Outstanding!!

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2014 Aroma is a mix of cherries, cranberries and a hint of sweetness.  The flavor is cranberries, mildly sweet cherries, malts an undercurrent of apples and an all around tart flavor into the finish.
Delicious. Combination of sour and tart with cherry, apple, and cranberry flow well together. complex but well balanced. a sipper

Bottle shared by Dallas and Bonnie, thanks 
Appearance: Clear red with a medium sized off-white head and good lacing
