Another great beer from Dan and the crew. Pours a maroon ruby red with pinkish head. The nose and taste are a beautifully balanced blend of the 3 fruits. Sweet tart cherry front, solid sweet apple middle, great tart cranberry finish. Great beer.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle received quite generously from bytemesis. Thanks a ton! Pours a brownish red with a sort of khaki to beige colored head of foam. The aroma has a nice cidery quality to it with fresh cut apples dominating and tart cherries coming through and then a sort of dark fruitiness from the cranberries that give it a chocolatey personality. This beer has a ton going on, and does it quite well. Taste is sweet, dark fruity sweetness. The wild fermentation actually contributes little in the way of tartness. I wish it would have done a little more, but thats not to detract from the supremacy of this beer. It is quite good.

Bottle thanks to Dallas. Pours a mostly clear red/purple color with a medium white head. A massive nose of cherry menthol candies. The flavor is not distinctly one flavor, but melds apples and cherry, light woodiness, light tartness, vibrant. Very nice, easygoing.
Cherry/mixed fruit Life Savers aroma and flavor. Sweet and tart flavor, and a little sore throat lozenge character (the good kind). Not much malt flavor.

750 ml bottle from Woodmans (Kenosha, WI). Shared with Jess before we decided how much to lug home. Pours a rich reddish rusty hue, some healthy berry notes. Cherries, cranberries, raspberry hues show mellow haze and darkness in the body. Rusty coppery glow and berry hues on the edges. A big frothy lightly tinged copper head sits atop, laces well and sits around for the duration, growing smaller but making its presence felt. Aromas are lush fruit, lots of tart and sweet cranberry, gentle harvest apple. Cherryskins, sweet fruit and tartness all envelope the senses. Richer lush nose of cranberry, cherry, and fruit. A touch of toasty malts, kiss of earthy brown malt, biscuit. Lots of fruit. Initial is medium bodied, lighter silky tapestry of cranberry, tart and sweeter intermingling, apples are tart and fruity, some cherryskins and tart cherry fruit into the backend. Overall, a melange of juicy fruit, tart and sweet elements playing off of each other well. Well carbonated, prickly with raspberries, seedy cherries. Touches of biscuity, earthy, gentle kiss of darker malt beneath really sneaks through at times, which is pleasant. Tart cranberries, cherries, apples. Toasty crisp malts into center, and that odd yet really welcome dash of cocoa or brown malt feel further back. Really well put together experience, lush fruit beer. Tart and sweet play off each other well. Quite fun. Some odes to Belgian Red with the backend from the cherry in my opinion, but malty bit and tart big cranberry and mellow apple elements show up and give some nice play. Really nice.

750mL bottle, courtesy of New Glarus. Thanks, folks! Pours a deep, clear burgundy, like Pinot Noir with a fine-bubbled, perfectly formed light-pink head; modest retention and nice lacing. Rich, ripe cherries and apple character in the nose, offering some of the vibrancy of both Belgian Red and Apple Ale; modest acidity and a very light tartness; theres also a very distinct note here that takes me back to childhood: a hint of Play-Doh, dead on, thats apparently quite a volatile aromatic, quickly disappearing after a minute in the glass; the aromas left behind are magnificent. Medium body; moderate, very fine CO2; a mouthwatering acidity and soft citric tartness. Theres a whole lot going on in this beer, and a further departure from Belgian Red and Apple Ale than the aroma might suggest: assertive acidity, cherry Jolly Ranchers, black cherries and apple juice... plus a light lemon-curd lactic tartness, almonds and (finally) even a toasty, lightly dry core that emerges with further almond on the finish. A more-than-worthy substitute for Belgian Red.

EXCELLENT beer!  Wonderful fruity aroma.  Effervescent head.  Multiple fruit flavors on the sides of the tongue.  Only negative is that its so effervescent, itll easily cause huge belches.  Youve been warned!

Enjoyed via a bottle from Discount Liquor. Pours a reddish brown with a medium, lacy head. The smell is of sparkling cider and berries. The taste is effervescent and so sour that it is prickly on the tongue. It is like Enigma and Belgian Red had a baby...one of my favorites from New Glarus.
UPDATED: NOV 23, 2012 A kaleidoscope of flavor says it all! The best happy accident ever. Heading back to  Wisconsin for a re-up soon

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2013 November 4, 2012 bottle from casanova. Brownish red pour with big head that faded quickly and spotty lacing. Cranberry, apple and sour cherry in the aroma. Taste was tart apple and cherry start and the cranberry came in the finish. Light and easy to drink.

This beer has a very fruity aroma and cherries really shine through.   Carbonation is mild and this beer goes down quite smooth. Certainly a sour beer with no bitter aftertaste. Better than any cherry lambric I've had.

Wow! Reddish pour, white head that disappeared quickly. Nose is apples, cherries, berries, yeast. Tart fruity flavors, berries, apples, light spice, tart finish.

Shared by the generous fella at the CCB tasting. The body has shades of red with yellow edges to it - very nice. It smelled like cherry candies and fresh sliced apples. Much better than the other NG fruit beers. It is tart, juicelike, and tasty as all fuck.

New glarus does it again. Beer was great im not a wine guy , so this was my wine . aroma is great , good finish very good fruit beer.

Pours ruby/cranberry colored with a medium tan/orange head...lively...beautiful color.  Aroma has tart apple and sweet cherry...mildly vinous.  Flavor showcases cranberry a bit more...tart...cherry creeps in...vinous and mildly oaky. UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 Bottle @ Armins bachelor party. Thanks Caleb! Pours a cloudy reddish appearance with a cream colored head. The nose really smelled like Juicy Juice or a Cran-Apple juice thats tart with notes of spice, yeast, tons of oak, rich fruits. 750 ml bottle.  Poiurs a deep reddish color with a small white head.  Aroma is mostly tart cherries with touches of cranberry and apple mixed in.  Flavor still has a big, beautiful cherry flavor but is a bit tarter, balances everything out quite a bit.  More apple and cranberry come out as it opens up a bit more.  Medium bodied, finishes on the tart end.  Lovely.  Beautiful beer from the master of fruit beers.
UPDATED: OCT 31, 2012 This is a beautiful accident. Crimson in color, fruity, sweet and spicy smell. Taste is delicious, cherry, apple, cranberry with a tart finish. An amazing beverage.

My god this was a delicious beer!!!

750ml bottle from Discount in Waukesha. Pours a very clear reddish-brown with a white head. Nice streaky lacing. Aroma has nicely distinct cherry, cranberry and apple notes, with some wood. Taste is of sweet tart cranberry and sour cherry, with some subtle apple contributing smoothness. Light body. Very wine-ish or a richer, less carbonated wine cooler - but with more fruit presence. Finishes sweet and tart, and stays around for a while. Very nice!

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2012 Bottle. Pours clear reddish ruby amber with a medium beige head that dissipates with some lacing. Aroma is strong cherry, with granny apple notes as well. Flavor is the same, quite sweet with some compensating tartness (cherry sweet tarts). Very much a fruit forward beer, with wonderully defined cherry notes. Not your typical beer, but quite yummy nonetheless.
Bottle. Pours amber with a very sweet, fruity nose. Flavor was tart cherry followed by apples and berries. Very sweet but a nice beer to try.

Bomber shared with sherm1016 and the wives...thanks.  Pours a rich reddish amber with a rich sweet, almost cherry cough syrup nose.  Rich cherry upfront with sweet apple in middle....and a hint of the cranberry at the end....almost like a dessert wine...too much of a sweet thing to do a session but a great treat!

Pours a dark reddish amber with a tall, creamy beige head that has great retention and leaves decent lacing. Huge, fruity aroma, lots of cherry, a hint of cranberry, light sweet bread spice, a little oak, sweet biscuit, hints of cereal grain. Some apple comes out in the aroma as it warms and the spicy notes become a little more noticeable. Great cherry and light cranberry flavors and tartness up front, cereal, light herbal and sweet bread/pie spice come in shortly after, some nice woody oak there as well, as it warms the apple comes out some more and the tartness and acidity are somewhat stronger, with something of a lactic or acetic feel to the acidity when it warms more. Liight to medium body with a light, blanketing and somewhat sharp carbonation and somewhat creamy, slightly sticky feel, leading to a slightly more dry finish with an acidic tingle. Amazing, easily one of my favorite New Glarus beers and one of my favorite fruit beers, hopefully it has a decent shelf life, or they decide to make it a year round release.

Pours dark amber / red with good sized white head. Aroma is tart cherry. Its got a little bt of sour funkyness to it also. The cranberrys are not very pronounced but they add a little bitterness. Very crisp and refreshing, with prety heavy carbonation, almost like drinking champagne. This is every bit as good the other 2 great year round fruit beers if not better. Pretty amazing.

Pours a reddish-pink color with a small pink head.  Aroma is sweet cranberries, cherries, and light apple.  Taste is very smooth and sweet, almost tastes like a robust Oceanspray Cranberry.  So frickin yummy.
Pours a reddish purple color with a fruity aroma, taste the apple and cherry with a tart finish.what a great accident!!

Smell is sweet with a touch of oak and some nice sourness. A very pleasant red color with a foamy pink head. Taste is sweet, gummy bears, cherry, apple and just a shade of the oak. Another great beer from NG.

Fantastic.  Pours a deep pink/red with light pink head.  Aroma is fruity, and full of variety.  Flavor is fantastic and complex with a bit of sour playing with the cranberry, apple, and cherry which are all distinct.

Pours a dark, purplish-amber, with nice-sized head. Aroma of cherry and cranberry. Flavor is a complex mix of all three fruits. Very sweet, as is the norm with New Glarus fruit beers. Bottle label had me expecting something a bit more on the sour side, but this is even better. These guys are the fruit beer masters and this is yet another top-shelf offering.

Bottle; Pour is fairly clear golden amber, with ruby highlighting;  the fine bubbled head is on the whitish side. The nose is apple and cherry - perhaps a hint of cranberry. I have to say I was expecting a blend of the three - but this one feels like a new brew and works pretty harmoniously. I like the depth of character, sweet, tart, and the wheat comes through - theres less of the barrel treatment than I was expecting - but overall ; another fantastic fruit beer from New Glarus

This is the best fruit beer I have had. Can really get the cranberry scent and some cherry/apple in the background. Taste is similar, has a nice smooth texture of juice. I hope this one sticks!

Less unique then one would think, still tasty though.

Bottle, shared. Pours pretty clear, dark purple with slight rust highlights. Small, wispy head. Nose is fresh berries, apple, slight tart cherry. Taste is similar: a little tart, very clean, a touch sweet. The acidity of all three fruits blends nicely here, which is really the beers crowning achievement. I could drink this all the time.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2012 Just happened to get in on a trade the day this was released. Awesome. Ruby pour with a very small white head. Aroma, JAM. Apple, cherry, raspberry, toffee. Flavor is bursting with sweet fruit, apple pie/fritter, caramel, toffee, apple skin, and oak (vanilla mainly). Slightly sour finish, juice like, prickly carbonation. The only down side is I wouldnt want more than a 4 oz pour of this. Between 4 people we didnt even finish the bottle. Ended up mixing some with some grapefruit juice and sparkling mineral water, which was amazing. Trying to drink a ton of this would be like trying to get full off of foie gras. Yeah, you probably can, but its much better in small portions. Its just too rich and jammy, but the 4.1 Im giving it is well deserved. 750ml bottle.  Deep murky burgundy. Quick fading beige-red head, soda-like carbonation bubbles rising to the top.  Sweet sugary cherry-apple aroma.  Big fruity tones, very reminiscent of the Belgian Red, but with some cranberry tartness in their.  The flavor is immense.  A really enjoyable beverage, but a little overbearing in its sweetness... more juice than beer at times.  Purple sweet tarts all the way.

Bottle.  A deep purple red pour.  Aroma is tart cran-apple.  Slightly floral and fragrant.  Flavor is a tart, yet sweet mix of green apple, cranberry, raspberry, and towards the end, a little cherry.  Sweetness does trail off leaving behind light fruit, wheat malt and vanilla.  Palate pretty well cleaned off for the next sip.  Still, a bit sweet.  Not as good as what its replacing, but still good.

I got a 750mL bottle of this from Woodmans in Janesville, WI in October 2012 for $8.79. 

Happy accident indeed! New Glarus took the poor cherry crop in 2012 in stride and came up with a new delicious brew. Serendipity pours a burnt reddish color with a slightly pink head. The scent is still mostly cherries but is overall very fruity and sweet smelling giving it that classic sour ale smell. Taste is sweet and fruity with all the main elements (cherry, cranberry, and apple) evident in the mix. Added to the mix was the great decision to age this in oak to make this an interesting, fruity, and delicious sour ale that is supposedly only to be around until Jan 1 in place of their usual Belgian Red. Get it while you can folks!

Poured from bottle, pours a dark ruby red with an off white soapy head, aroma has a ton of apple to start off, some cherry and the cranberry really didnt come through on the nose, the flavor literally has all three fruits together, all the apple and cherry comes through on the front end with a finish of the cranberries, sweet on the front and tart and sour in the finish, I am going to buy a ton of this.

Reddish hue big frothy white head with good lacing.  Aroma of green apple skins and cranberries with a hint of tart cherry as well.  A good amount of sweetness with the tart.  Well coated palate.  Sweet fruit cranberries mostly with a touch of Granny Smith apples.  Sweeter than I might have liked but delicious.

Bottle - Pours deep brown with a hint of red and a thin off white head. Nose is really pungent fruitiness, cherry coming through strong, but with a touch of cranberry tartness. The apple finally comes through in the taste, sweet and crisp, with real strong cherry in the middle, and the cranberry tartness coming through on the finish. Real sweet like the Belgian Red, so youve got to know that coming into it, but this is fantastic.

1pint 9oz bottle. Pours out a very nice deep red, similar to grape juice. Thick head that fades fast but remains thin around the glass throughout. Strong fruit aroma, cherry dominating. Lightly carbonated and lighter bodied. Sweet apple and cherry on the tongue with a tart finish. Great balance of fruit flavors! Complex and a very enjoyable beer!

750ml bottle, purchased at Discount Liquor Milwaukee, split with my wife. Pours a crystal clear, deep, blood red color with a thin white head.  Aroma is fruity, cherry, apple.  Medium body on the palate with lively, prickly carbonation.  Flavor is sweet and tart, all of the fruit comes through in my opinion, apple up front, cranberry in the middle, with a sweet cherry finish.  More tart than the Belgian Red.  The fruit flavors are more complex than the other two.  If you like the other fruit beers from New Glarus, youll like this.  Another fantastic fruit beer.
